full_description: A dicembre si giocherÃ  al Maradona Cup: si sfideranno Barcellona e Boca Juniors, assente il Napoli messo sotto accusa in Argentina Tra quattro giorni sarÃ  il suo compleanno, tra un mese farÃ  un anno dalla sua morte. Diego Armando Maradona ha lasciato un vuoto incolmabile nel mondo del calcio. A lui Ã¨ stato dedicato lo stadio di Napoli , a lui sarÃ  intitolata una sfida che vedrÃ  in campo Boca Juniors e Barcellona , due delle squadre che hanno potuto godere del suo infinito talento in campo. La Maradona Cup Ã¨ stata ufficializzata ieri e si disputerÃ  il prossimo 14 dicembre in Arabia Saudita. Un appuntamento al quale non ci sarÃ  il Napoli, squadra che ha segnato la carriera del Pibe de Oro. Unâ€™assenza che ha destato sorpresa e per la quale una spiegazione arriva proprio dallâ€™Argentina. Eâ€™ â€˜Infobaeâ€™ a raccontare il motivo per il quale la societÃ  partenopea non sarÃ  presente alla Maradona Cup e il motivo Ã¨ legato ai soldi. Tutte le news sulla SERIE A e non solo: CLICCA QUI! Secondo quanto spiegato dal portale sudamericano, gli organizzatori della Maradona Cup, gli spagnoli della RG Consultant & Sport Solutions SL, avrebbero avuto un incontro con Aurelio De Laurentiis , presidente del Napoli, per invitare la societÃ  azzurra al torneo per ricordare il Pibe de Oro. Un invito perÃ² respinto dal patron del club partenopeo. LEGGI ANCHE >>> Napoli, il Giudice Sportivo non perdona: Spalletti punito, ma non solo Come spiega â€˜Infobaeâ€™, infatti, De Laurentiis avrebbe chiesto 5 milioni di euro netti per la partecipazione al torneo, oltre al pagamento delle spese di viaggio e pernottamento. Inoltre il Napoli avrebbe voluto anche una parte dei diritti televisivi. Una richiesta respinta dagli organizzatori che hanno, invece, trovato un accordo con Barcellona e Boca Juniors. CosÃ¬ la Maradona Cup sarÃ  senza la squadra azzurra.

title: Percat completes Walkinshaw Andretti United line-up
description: The four-time Supercars race winner has long been linked to a sensational return to the Walkinshaw fold in place of outgoing WAU driver Bryce Fullwood.That's now been made official, WAU today confirming that Percat will partner Mostert in an all-star line-up for 2022 and beyond.Percat has a long history with the Clayton squad, having carried Walkinshaw support back when he was racing ...Keep reading
full_description: The four-time Supercars race winner has long been linked to a sensational return to the Walkinshaw fold in place of outgoing WAU driver Bryce Fullwood . That's now been made official, WAU today confirming that Percat will partner Mostert in an all-star line-up for 2022 and beyond. Percat has a long history with the Clayton squad, having carried Walkinshaw support back when he was racing Formula Ford in the late 2000s. He then drove for the team in Super2 in the early 2010s, and took a remarkable Bathurst 1000 win as a rookie alongside Garth Tander for the Walkinshaw-run Holden Racing Team in 2011. The Tander/Percat Holden Commodore is now owned by WAU part-owner Zak Brown. In 2014 Percat completed a single full main game season in a fourth Walkinshaw entry before parting ways with the organisation to join LD Motorsport the following year. He has now been wooed back to Clayton to partner Mostert following his somewhat unexpected split with Brad Jones Racing just weeks after announcing a new deal. â€œI am extremely excited and grateful to be joining Walkinshaw Andretti United . Having been with the Walkinshaw family during my junior days in Formula Ford and Super2 this is where I feel at home," said Percat. â€œIâ€™ve dreamt of having my name next to the #2 from a very young age and now for it to be reality is amazing. I cannot wait to repay the faith to the team, especially Ryan and Martine [Walkinshaw]. "The Walkinshaw family has been a huge part of my career since 2007. â€œDriving alongside Chaz is something I am really looking forward to, he is undoubtedly one of the fastest guys on the grid. We spent a lot of time racing against each other since Formula Ford so now Iâ€™m excited to be joining forces with him as we work together to continue the teamâ€™s progression to the front of the grid.â€ Ryan Walkinshaw added: â€œItâ€™s fantastic to have Nick back with our team. Nick and my family share a great history together, and Iâ€™m excited at the opportunity to add to that going forward. â€œWe saw what a talent Nick was from a young age, working with him as he climbed the ranks into a main game driver and a Bathurst winner, and now to have him back home is really fitting. "Heâ€™s a fantastic driver, and his performances prove he belongs in the conversation of the top drivers in the category." Bryce Fullwood, Walkinshaw Andretti United Holden Photo by: Mark Horsburgh, Edge Photographics The Percat deal marks a straight swap with Fullwood, who is headed to BJR for the 2022 season. With Matt Stone Racing having announced its completed line-up earlier today, Jack Le Brocq to join Todd Hazelwood , the 2022 grid is now effectively locked in. Two of the three spots yet to be made official are at BJR, although Macauley Jones and Jack Smith are expected to partner newcomers Andre Heimgartner and Jack Smith . The other is at Kelly Grove Racing , which is waiting on a Superlicence exemption for Kiwi teenager Matt Payne. The 2022 Supercars drivers Blanchard Racing Team Tim Slade Tickford Racing Cameron Waters James Courtney Jake Kostecki Thomas Randle Dick Johnson Racing Anton De Pasquale Will Davison Kelly Grove Racing David Reynolds Matt Payne* Brad Jones Racing Andre Heimgartner Bryce Fullwood Macauley Jones * Jack Smith* Erebus Motorsport Will Brown Brodie Kostecki Team 18 Mark Winterbottom Scott Pye Team Sydney Fabian Coulthard Garry Jacobson Walkinshaw Andretti United Chaz Mostert Nick Percat Matt Stone Racing Todd Hazelwood Jack Le Brocq Triple Eight Race Engineering Broc Feeney Shane van Gisbergen *TBC shares comments

title: Bastianini â€œwasnâ€™t confidentâ€ of Misano MotoGP podium return
description: Bastianini claimed his maiden MotoGP podium five weeks ago when MotoGP last visited Misano for the San Marino GP having come from 12th on the grid.A repeat looked unlikely after he suffered three crashes on Saturday and qualified down in 16th.However, the 2020 Moto2 world champion once again climbed up the order and capitalised on high attrition to snatch third away from Yamahaâ€™s Fabio ...Keep reading
full_description: Bastianini claimed his maiden MotoGP podium five weeks ago when MotoGP last visited Misano for the San Marino GP having come from 12th on the grid. A repeat looked unlikely after he suffered three crashes on Saturday and qualified down in 16th. However, the 2020 Moto2 world champion once again climbed up the order and capitalised on high attrition to snatch third away from Yamahaâ€™s Fabio Quartararo on the final lap. â€œYes, it stayed a very difficult weekend for me,â€ Bastianini said after the race. â€œYesterday I destroyed three bikes in eight laps, and today I wasnâ€™t confident to arrive on the podium. â€œBut after many laps during the race I saw my pace and it was really close to the first group with Marc [Marquez] and Pecco [Bagnaia]. â€œThe last 10 laps I pushed a lot to recover some positions and in the end I was in fourth place. â€œAlso, I saw Fabio very close to me and in the last lap I pushed all to recover to him and I passed Fabio at the Caro [hairpin]. â€œAlso, I want to say thanks to my team because they did a very, very good job yesterday and also today. â€œThe battle with Fabio was very strange because he was battling for the title and in the end won. â€œBut inside me I thought only I wanted to arrive in third place because I was very close to him. I stayed polished in my overtaking, so Iâ€™m happy.â€ Enea Bastianini, Esponsorama Racing Photo by: Gold and Goose / Motorsport Images This marked Bastianiniâ€™s fourth-successive top six result of his rookie campaign, but insists he must improve his qualifying results having started the last four rounds ninth, 12th and 16th. â€œI think the qualifying because every time I start from ninth to 16th,â€ he replied when asked what he needs to improve going forward. Read Also: Mirâ€™s Misano MotoGP jump start due to launch control confusion The three factors that crowned MotoGPâ€™s newest champion at Misano â€œThis is not good for the race because I have to do a lot of overtaking. â€œI think we have to work also on the Saturday in FP4 to do more laps consecutively because always I did short runs. Now we study what we can do for the next races.â€ shares comments

title: Zinedine Zidane 'not interested in Manchester United job'
description: Former Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane reportedly has no interest in replacing Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as Manchester United manager.
full_description: On the back of the 5-0 reverse against Liverpool on Sunday, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer 's long-term future at Old Trafford has been left up in the air. While the Norwegian has categorically insisted that he will not resign, speculation persists that United's owners may opt to make a replacement. However, according to reports in Spain , Zidane does not want to be considered as an alternative in the United dugout for the foreseeable future. The former Real Madrid boss, who has been out of a job since the summer, is said to be content with taking a sabbatical before deciding on his next role. The report adds that only an opportunity at Paris Saint-Germain or with France would peak Zidane's interest in the short term.

title: Lovlina, Shiva Thapa In Contention For Place In AIBA Athletes Committee
description: Olympic bronze-winner Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa are in contention to be Asia's representatives in the International Boxing Association's (AIBA) athletes committee.
full_description: Olympic bronze-winner Lovlina Borgohain and five-time Asian medallist Shiva Thapa are in contention to be Asia's representatives in the International Boxing Association's (AIBA) athletes committee, which will be formed through voting during the world championships for men and women. The men's showpiece is currently in progress in Belgrade, where Thapa is competing in the 63.5kg category. The Assam boxer is a former bronze-winner at the event. The women's event is planned for December in Turkey and Borgohain will compete there after being picked for the squad on the basis of her Tokyo Olympics performance. She has previously won two bronze medals in the marquee tournament. AIBA received 34 nominations from five confederations, of which 27 were found to be eligible by its ethics committee. If any of the two Indians is elected, it would ensure the country's presence in the panel for a second successive time after veteran L Sarita Devi, a former world champion, made it unopposed in 2019 during the tenure of interim president Mohamed Moustahsane. The Asian bloc's contenders include three women and four men. Borgohain will be challenged by North Korea's Pang Chol Mih, a former world champion and two-time Asian-medallist, and Kazakhstan's Nayzm Kyzaibay, a two-time world champion and the reigning Asian gold-medallist. Thapa will be up against reigning Olympic champion Bakhodir Jalolov of Uzbekistan, Pakistan's Awais Ali Khan, and Kazakhstan's Ablaikhan Zhussupov, a two-time world and Asian Championships medal winner. "The Athletes Committee will be composed of 10 people, with the newly-elected Chair and Vice-Chair becoming voting members of the AIBA Board of Directors," the AIBA stated. One male and one female member from each confederation will be elected by the registered boxers who are/will be in attendance at the world championships. "Each election shall be conducted by a secret ballot. AIBA shall decide if electronic or paper ballots shall be used," the world body said. The term of office of the athletes committee members will be until the 2025 World Championships, a much longer run than what the previous panel got. During their term, the members of the Committee would expected to work to ensure that the views and opinions of boxers are represented within AIBA. "One of the tasks of the new members of the Committee will be working with and supporting AIBA's mission to develop and promote the sport of boxing everywhere," AIBA President Umar Kremlev said. Promoted "Considering the challenges we are overcoming at the moment, we truly need people who are ready to fight for a brighter future of our beloved sport. And who can fight better than boxers themselves?," he said. "At AIBA, we value everyone's input in our reforms. In the end, all of our work is on behalf of boxers and those who support them. So it is vital for us to hear what the boxers have to say," he added.

title: Horner: "Chuck the form book away" in F1 title run-in
description: Red Bull and Max Verstappen are widely regarded as favourites for the event, with the Dutchman having won in 2017 and 2018 and been fastest in qualifying in 2019 before he received a grid penalty.However, after Verstappen won last weekendâ€™s US GP in Austin â€“ a track usually associated with success for Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes â€“Â HornerÂ says itâ€™s impossible to predict which ...Keep reading
full_description: Red Bull and Max Verstappen are widely regarded as favourites for the event, with the Dutchman having won in 2017 and 2018 and been fastest in qualifying in 2019 before he received a grid penalty. However, after Verstappen won last weekendâ€™s US GP in Austin â€“ a track usually associated with success for Lewis Hamilton and Mercedes â€“ Horner says itâ€™s impossible to predict which of the title contenders will have the upper hand. "I think you've got to chuck the form book away,â€ he said. â€œIt's very tight between the two teams. Mexico has been a good track for us, but it's been a good track for them as well, on occasion. So we don't underestimate them.â€ Horner stressed that the Austin success was significant for his team: "They are all important, but this is a big one, because this has been such a stronghold of Lewis and Mercedes. â€œSo to get the pole was a landmark moment for us, and then to convert into a win, even not leading on the first lap.â€ He added that the team cannot become too confident, despite the Austin result extending Verstappenâ€™s lead. â€œYou've got to attack. So 12 points is nothing, it can disappear very, very quickly, as we've seen previously. â€œSo we've got to keep attacking race weekends and get the most out of them that we possibly can. And five to go, the pressure only gets bigger." Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB16B Photo by: Zak Mauger / Motorsport Images Mercedes trackside engineering director Andrew Shovlin admitted that the world champions expect a tough fight with Red Bull in Mexico. â€œIf you look ahead to Mexico, that is a track in the past that has suited them and has suited the Honda power unit,â€ he said. â€œBut regardless of that weâ€™ve still got to arrive with a car that is performing at the best of the carâ€™s ability, and give a car to Lewis and Valtteri [Bottas] that allows them to do their best job. â€œThat is the only thing we are working on, we are not really worrying about where Red Bull are." Asked if Mercedes could surprise Red Bull in Mexico, Shovlin said: â€œHonestly, if we can take the race to them like we did today that is probably the best case scenario that we can envisage. â€œThere is a lot to do, and it is such a different circuit, and such a different environment for the power unit to operate in. â€œBut there have not been many circuits where we have been far off the pace. We have struggled in Monaco, we were struggling in Baku and we struggled a bit in the second Austria, but there are more of them where we can challenge and we can challenge for pole. â€œAs I said we know weâ€™ve struggled there in the past, and we know what we need to be working on in the next week or so, and that is what we will get stuck into.â€ shares comments

title: Fix: Honda in SBK-WM 2022 mit Lecuona und Vierge
description: Was regelmÃ¤ÃŸige Leser von SPEEDWEEK.com bereits lÃ¤nger wissen, wurde nun von Honda bestÃ¤tigt. In der Superbike-WM 2022 tritt Honda mit Iker Lecuona and Xavi Vierge an.
full_description: Nun ist es offiziell: Das Werksteam der Honda Racing Corporation wird in der Superbike-WM 2022 mit zwei neuen Piloten antreten. Denn nachdem Alvaro Bautista fÃ¼r die Superbike-WM 2022 zum Aruba.it Ducati-Werksteam zurÃ¼ckkehrt wurde vor wenigen Minuten bestÃ¤tigt, dass die Zusammenarbeit mit Leon Haslam mit dem Saisonfinale in Indonesien endet. Mit Iker Lecuona und Xavi Vierge nimmt der weltgrÃ¶ÃŸte Motorradhersteller nicht nur eine drastische VerjÃ¼ngungskur vor, sondern setzt auch auf zwei, die noch nie ein Superbike fuhren, die Pirelli-Reifen und auch einige Strecken nicht kennen. Beide sind seit vielen Jahren auf Prototypen unterwegs. Lecuona ist seit 2016 im Grand-Prix-Paddock. Zuerst fuhr er vier Jahre in der Moto2-Klasse, 2020 und dieses Jahr ist er beim MotoGP-Team Tech 3 KTM unter Vertrag. Seine Statistik beeindruckt wenig: In bislang 82 Grands Prix schaffte er es nur zweimal aufs Podium: als Zweiter und Dritter in der Moto2-WM. Eine Weltmeisterschaft beendete er nie besser als auf dem zwÃ¶lften Platz, 2018 und 2019 in Moto2. Dass der 21-JÃ¤hrige Ã¼ber Talent mit groÃŸen Bikes verfÃ¼gt, beweist er in diesem Jahr: Dreimal preschte er auf der KTM RC16 in die Top-10 und brillierte als Sechster im Nassen auf dem Red Bull Ring und als Siebter im Trockenen in Silverstone. Vierge fÃ¤hrt seit 2015 in der Moto2-WM, holte vier PodestplÃ¤tze, aber keinen Sieg. Sein bestes Ergebnis in der laufenden Saison eroberte er als Dritter auf seiner Heimstrecke in Barcelona, in der Gesamtwertung liegt der 24-JÃ¤hrige auf Rang 10. Das ist auch seine bislang beste Platzierung in der Weltmeisterschaft.

title: Fonseca overtaken as Newcastle enter â€˜decisiveâ€™ talks with new first choice
creator: Samuel Bannister
description: An appointment is expected by the end of the week and reports in Germany claim there is a new order on the wish-list The post Fonseca overtaken as Newcastle enter â€˜decisiveâ€™ talks with new first choice appeared first on TEAMtalk.
content: A new favourite has emerged in the running to become the next manager of Newcastle United, according to reports. Steve Bruce was recently dismissed by Newcastleâ€™s wealthy new owners, who are now looking for his replacement. Graeme Jones has overseen one of the two games he will spend as their interim manager. A permanent replacement, therefore, should be on the horizon. To date, the favourite has been thought to be Paulo Fonseca. After negotiations with Tottenham Hotspur collapsed over the summer, the former Roma boss could get another chance to move into the Premier League. Fonseca reportedly impressed Amanda Staveley in an interview. Therefore, he has seemed likely to take over at St Jamesâ€™ Park. However, there has now been a twist. According to Bild, Lucien Favre has jumped to the front of the queue to fill the vacancy. Favre most recently managed Borussia Dortmund between 2018 and 2020. Over the summer, he was under consideration by Crystal Palace, but he had a change of heart and decided not to take the job. Like Fonseca, though, that hasnâ€™t necessarily closed the door to him taking a different Premier League job. Newcastle are now said to be in talks with Favre, which have reached a â€œdecisiveâ€ stage. Fonseca has, for now, been relegated to â€œsecond choiceâ€. Bild expect the new manager to be presented by the end of the week. They are confident it could be Favre. Favre ready for new challenge The Swiss coach, 63, has enjoyed a lengthy career in football. During his playing days, he was capped 24 times by his national team. Since 1993, he has been working from the other side of the touchline. His first job in management was with Echallens, whom he led to promotion at the first time of asking. He has since gone on to represent the likes of FC Zurich, Hertha Berlin and Nice. His longest tenure in a job was the four years he spent in charge of Borussia Monchengladbach between February 2011 and September 2015. Favre has won trophies with Servette (the 2000-01 Swiss Cup), Zurich (back-to-back Swiss league titles in 2006 and 2007 after cup success in 2005) and Dortmund (the 2019 DFL-Supercup). The latter job was his most successful in terms of the points per game he accumulated. At the time of his exit, he was also the Dortmund coach with the best ever point average. He won 68 of his 110 matches in charge, but it all came to an end when he lost 5-1 to Stuttgart in December 2020. Favre has been waiting for the right opportunity since and it seems Newcastle may provide him with the next platform. It would be his first job in the Premier League and the fourth different country he has managed in after Switzerland, Germany and France. content: Feiert Julian Nagelsmann morgen Abend sein Comeback auf der Trainerbank des FC Bayern? Aktuellen Medienberichten zufolge soll ein PCR-Test am heutigen Dienstag fÃ¼r Klarheit sorgen. Bayern-PrÃ¤sident Herbert Hainer hatte sich am Montagabend noch zuversichtlich gezeigt und betont, dass es Nagelsmann mittlerweile â€œviel besser gehen wÃ¼rdeâ€. Der 67-jÃ¤hrige geht davon aus, dass der FCB-Coach im DFB-Pokal gegen Borussia MÃ¶nchengladbach wieder an die Seitenlinie zurÃ¼ckkehren wird. Wie der â€œkickerâ€ berichtet, wird Nagelsmann heute PCR-Test absolvieren. FÃ¤llt dieser negativ aus, wird dieser morgen tatsÃ¤chlich wieder auf die MÃ¼nchner Trainerbank zurÃ¼ckkehren. full_description: Bremen â€“ Er war weg, ist wieder da und doch noch nicht dabei: Auf KapitÃ¤n und Abwehrchef Ã–mer Toprak muss Werder Bremen weiter auf unbestimmte Zeit warten. Nachdem der 32-JÃ¤hrige seine Wadenverletzung einige Zeit in Leverkusen hatte behandeln lassen, setzt er sein Reha-Programm zwar seit wenigen Tagen wieder in Bremen fort, doch dass er deshalb an der Schwelle zum Comeback steht, ist eine falsche Interpretation der Situation, sagt Ã–mer Toprak . Zwar habe die medizinische Abteilung einen Fahrplan erstellt, um ihn wieder spielfit zu bekommen, â€aber zu sagen, an diesem oder jenem Tag bin ich zurÃ¼ck, das habe ich mir abgewÃ¶hntâ€œ, erklÃ¤rt er im â€Strom-Talkâ€œ des SV Werder Bremen . Werder Bremens KapitÃ¤n Ã–mer Toprak kann keine Prognose fÃ¼r Comeback geben Also: keine Prognose. Dabei gehe es der Wade â€ganz gutâ€œ, so Toprak: â€Aber weil ich lange gefehlt habe, geht es jetzt erstmal darum, wieder Kondition und Fitness aufzubauen.â€œ Nach sechs Wochen Auszeit muss das sein. An der eigenen Ungeduld Ã¤ndert das aber nichts. Ã–mer Toprak , der die zurÃ¼ckliegenden, wenig erfolgreichen AuswÃ¤rtsspiele des SV Werder Bremen in Darmstadt (0:3) und Sandhausen (2:2) â€zu Hause und allein vor dem Fernseherâ€œ verfolgt hat, hÃ¤lt es nach eigener Aussage kaum noch aus, tatenlos zusehen zu mÃ¼ssen. â€Ich bin ein schwieriger Verletzter. Wenn die Ergebnisse so sind, wie sie sind, bin ich sehr sauerâ€œ, sagt er. Sein Eindruck nach den letzten Partien: â€Ich habe ich das GefÃ¼hl, dass die Jungs mich brauchen. Aber leider kann ich nur von auÃŸen Hilfestellung geben.â€œ (csa) Lest dazu: RÃ¤nge in Rage: Wie Werder mit der zunehmenden Fan-Kritik umgeht !

And that could pave the way for Matthijs de Ligt to join Chelsea, with Juventus said to be keen to get the Â£280,000-a-week Dutch centre-back off their books. And Newcastle are still looking for a new permanent manager with Paulo Fonseca the favourite. Stay up to date with all the latest from around the clubs with our live blogâ€¦

title: Newcastle make Rafa Benitez No1 choice to replace Steve Bruce as bossâ€¦ but proving difficult to get him out of Everton
creator: Etienne Fermie
description: RAFA BENITEZ is Newcastleâ€™s â€˜dreamâ€™ successor to Steve Bruce. But the Spaniard will be difficult to prise from Everton. Benitez, 61, left St Jamesâ€™ Park in 2019 after becoming fed up of working under Mike Ashley. He next managed Dalian Professional in China, before returning to the Premier League at Goodison Park in the summer. [â€¦]
content: RAFA BENITEZ is Newcastleâ€™s â€˜dreamâ€™ successor to Steve Bruce. But the Spaniard will be difficult to prise from Everton. AFPRafael Benitez watched his side lose 5-2 to Watford last time out[/caption] Benitez, 61, left St Jamesâ€™ Park in 2019 after becoming fed up of working under Mike Ashley. He next managed Dalian Professional in China, before returning to the Premier League at Goodison Park in the summer. His appointment was met with fury by loyal Evertonians, who were against hiring a former Liverpool manager. But owner Farhad Moshiri ignored the concerns of supporters and hired his man anyway. According to DiMarzio, who spoke to Mybettingsites.co.uk, it is â€˜really difficultâ€™ for Benitez to leave Everton now. The Toon have spoken to former Roma boss Paulo Fonseca, with chiefs including Amanda Staveley interviewing the Portuguese on Zoom last Wednesday. Most read in Football CHEW ARE YER? Paul Scholes mocked as daughter shares video of him chewing her TOENAILS OL BE DAMNED Man Utd 'considering SACKING Solskjaer in days' after Liverpool humiliation UP FOUR IT Man Utd draw up four-man shortlist to replace Solskjaer including Rodgers ACE'S NEW LOVE Spurs ace Dele Alli enjoys date with Made In Chelsea newcomer Nicole Berry SHIRT STORY Man Utd fan asks and gets Roberto Firmino's shirt after Liverpool hammering ON THE PAUL Ferdinand mocks Scholes after Utd legend was caught biting daughter's TOENAILS FREE BETS: GET OVER Â£2,000 IN NEW CUSTOMER DEALS But a decision hasnâ€™t yet been made on who will succeed Steve Bruce. Everton were humiliated on Saturday, collapsing late on to lose 5-2 to Watford at Goodison. According to the Mirror, sporting director Marcel Brands was â€˜dead againstâ€™ appointing Benitez in the summer. But he was overruled by Moshiri and investor Alisher Usmanov. Benitezâ€™s Everton contract runs until 2024. Graeme Jones oversaw Newcastleâ€™s 1-1 draw at Crystal Palace on Saturday. And Bruceâ€™s former No2 is expected to take charge of the Toonâ€™s next match against Chelsea on Saturday before a decision is made. title: Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow
creator: Olly Dawes
description: Liverpool take on Preston North End in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday night and may have dropped a big hint about their team selection for... The post Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC/Liverpool FC via Getty Images Liverpool take on Preston North End in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday night and may have dropped a big hint about their team selection for the game. The Reds beat Manchester United 5-0 on Sunday to seal a dream eight days, picking up a win over Atletico Madrid and hammering Watford too. Now, the attention turns to the Carabao Cup and a short trip to Lancashire to take on Championship side Preston. North End arenâ€™t faring well in the Championship right now and that may give Liverpool a chance to blood some young players. If Liverpool fans needed a hint in that direction, last nightâ€™s Under-23 game gave it. Liverpool teenagers left out ahead of Preston trip Liverpool took on Blackburn Rovers in Premier League 2 on Monday night, but they named a team lacking some key players. Conor Bradley, James Balagizi, Mateusz Musialowski, Kaide Gordon and Tyler Morton were all left out of the Liverpool side last night. Photo by Stephen Pond/Getty Images Thatâ€™s a major hit that all five players will be involved in Jurgen Kloppâ€™s Liverpool squad against Preston on Wednesday. Bradley and Gordon started in the last round against Norwich City, with Balagizi and Morton now on the bench for that game. Musialowski could now join in with Liverpool looking to give their young players a chance at Deepdale. Photo by Nick Taylor/Liverpool FC/Liverpool FC via Getty Images The post Liverpool have just dropped a major hint about Jurgen Klopp's squad to face Preston tomorrow appeared first on HITC.

title: 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced
creator: Oliver Harden
description: There comes a point in a driver's career when, oozing so much speed and self-confidence, they begin to have the look and feel of a champion. The post 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced appeared first on PlanetF1.
content: There comes a point in a Formula One driverâ€™s career when, oozing so much speed and self-confidence, they begin to have the look and feel of a World Champion. For Max Verstappen, that day came at the Dutch Grand Prix at the start of September. Max had performed in front of large and expectant crowds before, of course, winning at Red Bullâ€™s own circuit in Austria a total of four times (twice in 2021) and securing a victory of sorts in his second home race at Spa the previous weekend. But Zandvoort felt different. This, after all, was the race always meant to revolve around him and one that only existed because of him, the event the Dutch fans and their devotion to Verstappen had deserved since his F1 debut in 2015. The compact and high-downforce nature of Suzukaâ€™s younger sibling favoured Red Bull, no doubt, but there was still a job to be done and plenty of potential â€“ with Verstappen embarking upon the climb to the crescendo of his first championship challenge at tender the age of 23 â€“ for it to go terribly and embarrassingly wrong. Rather than conducting the human heat of the 72,000 spectators in the style of Lewis Hamilton at Silverstone, however, Verstappen simply ignored it. There was a businesslike quality â€“ call it a robotic Red Bullness â€“ about Verstappen at Zandvoort as he came through the clouds of orange smoke to convert a routine pole position into a routine win, politely acknowledging the crowd without ever being carried away by them. They came, they saw, he conquered. Cutting the cord to his emotions has been a recurring theme of Verstappenâ€™s 2021 season, allowing him to treat those two imposters, victory and defeat, just the same. Just as he refused to be fazed by the festival atmosphere at Zandvoort, so he declined to take Pirelliâ€™s tyre failure in Baku â€“ costing him a certain 25 points â€“ as a personal insult, instead finding comfort from his pace and winning each of the following three races. That clarity of thought and inherent level-headedness has seen Verstappen develop a total immunity to pressure, which was again highlighted in the closing stages of a United States Grand Prix in which he further underlined his status as a World Champion in all but name. Winners at @COTA in the turbo hybrid era: 2014 â€“ Mercedes2015 â€“ Mercedes2016 â€“ Mercedes2017 â€“ Mercedes2018 â€“ Ferrari2019 â€“ Mercedes 2021 â€“ Red Bull What. A. Drive. #USGP #F1 pic.twitter.com/YwuD460EIf â€” PlanetF1 (@Planet_F1) October 24, 2021 Perhaps Verstappenâ€™s greatest achievement of 2021 has been to gradually eradicate the jeopardy in the air whenever he has found himself in the lead of a race. In previous years, with Verstappen slightly more impetuous and the Red Bull package slightly weaker, there was an overhanging sense that â€“ in an era of crushing Hamilton and Mercedes dominance â€“ it was too good to be true, that trouble was only ever just around the corner. Reality again appeared to be hitting Red Bull in the face at the Circuit of the Americas as Hamilton, on tyres eight laps younger â€“ a significant difference under the hot Texan sun â€“ caught Verstappen in the ferociously familiar fashion of Hungary 2019 and Spain earlier this year. Yet Verstappen remained calm and recognised what was required, perfectly judging the delicate balance between keeping Hamilton behind and keeping his hard tyres in good enough condition. When Hamilton hovered around a second behind in the final laps, Verstappen instinctively understood the importance of pushing hard through the first sector â€“ his Sector 1 time on the last lap was the fastest of anyone all race â€“ to deny him DRS assistance down the long back straight. If remaining poised under the expectation of Zandvoort was one thing, keeping the King of COTA behind in those circumstances and with so much on the line was quite another. His 18th career victory, and his eighth of 2021, was arguably his finest to date and yet another reminder that Verstappen is unlike anything Hamilton has faced before. He will not, regardless of his occasionally spiky answers to those in the FIA press conferences craving another collision between the pair, waste energy picking fights a la Fernando Alonso in 2007. He wonâ€™t allow himself to be worn down in the way Nico Rosberg was â€“ finally beating Lewis to the title in 2016 but, in career terms, dying trying â€“ and he is surely not set to self-destruct like Sebastian Vettel in 2017 and 2018. The potentially decisive significance of Austin is reflected in the Driversâ€™ standings, with Verstappen now holding a 12-point lead over Hamilton with five races remaining â€“ the largest advantage for either driver since July â€“ when a Hamilton win would have seen him regain top spot by a single point. Given Red Bullâ€™s historically strong record in the high altitude of Mexico, where Verstappen won with ease in 2017 and 2018, and Brazil, where he was on course to win comfortably until that collision with Esteban Ocon in â€˜18 before making up for it a year later, the opportunity to take control of the title race is obvious. And how will the thinner air of those venues affect a Mercedes team suddenly very nervous over the state of their power units, with Valtteri Bottas taking engine penalties in his last four races and relentless rumours of Hamilton requiring another before the season is over? In that context, when the American leg of the calendar is completed it is not outlandish to envisage Verstappenâ€™s lead â€“ with bonus points for fastest laps and the Interlagos sprint race handed out â€“ being above the magic 25-point mark, affording him the luxury of retaining the championship lead even in the event of a DNF. Â  Hamilton, of course, remains an ever-present threat, and if there is growing concern at Mercedes High Performance Powertrains it is remarkable that Honda â€“ given how it initially re-entered F1 in a cloud of smoke â€“ is yet to suffer a serious engine problem in its farewell season. But as in his 2016 defeat to Rosberg, there is an undeniable sense that Hamiltonâ€™s litany of lost points in Baku, Budapest and the sprints of Silverstone and Monza â€“ combined with Mercedesâ€™ stubborn refusal to compromise next yearâ€™s program by maintaining development of the 2021 car â€“ may have left him with too much to do in too little time. In this fascinating study of psychology that has been the 2021 F1 title battle, Hamilton of all people has been the one to crack most frequently. And it has left Verstappen with as clear a path as he couldâ€™ve wished for towards his first World Championship. Pressure? What pressure? Â  Â  The post 2021 Max is unlike anything Hamilton has faced appeared first on PlanetF1.

title: 'Thatâ€™s a huge risk': Some Arsenal fans are sceptical over Arteta's reported game plan tonight
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta is reportedly set to start a strong XI this evening against Leeds United in the League Cup. According to Football London,... The post 'Thatâ€™s a huge risk': Some Arsenal fans are sceptical over Arteta's reported game plan tonight appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Stuart MacFarlane/Arsenal FC via Getty Images Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta is reportedly set to start a strong XI this evening against Leeds United in the League Cup. According to Football London, the Basque manager is keen to keep Arsenalâ€™s momentum from Friday night going after a blistering 3-1 win over Aston Villa in the Premier League. With no Europe, the League Cup is the only source of tournament football for Arsenal this season. Meaning that fringe players and youngsters have not played too much this campaign. The likes of Gabriel Martinelli, Folarin Balogun and Eddie Nketiah have struggled for first-team minutes. And thatâ€™s in large part to a lack of European football. How Would A Squad Of Free Agents Do In The Championship? Football Manager 2021 ExperimentBridTV5827How Would A Squad Of Free Agents Do In The Championship? Football Manager 2021 Experiment883307883307centerUCsIwxKQajD9zPQA4SufVXggElecspo (Youtube)https://yt3.ggpht.com/a/AATXAJxUznA4lOkmaqkQUT9LEkoByQ5fpNm5IHUYaw=s800-c-k-c0xffffffff-no-rj-mo13872 Indeed, whilst it makes sense for Arsenal to go strong against Leeds, it will no doubt anger some players within the club. Bernd Leno, Rob Holding and Pablo Mari have not played a single minute of football since the 3-0 League Cup win against AFC Wimbledon. Yet tonight could see a very similar XI which saw Arsenal claim a huge three points over Villa last week. With Alexandre Lacazete, Albert Sambi Lokonga and Thomas Partey all featuring. Arsenal fans arenâ€™t sold on Artetaâ€™s plan for Leeds Photo by Robbie Jay Barratt â€“ AMA/Getty Images As you would expect, this update ahead of tonightâ€™s clash against Leeds has not gone down well with Arsenal fans. The League Cup is seen as a competition where talents from the academy can play first-team football. But tonight, Arteta is opting for a strong XI to face Leeds, and hereâ€™s what some Arsenal fans had to say on Twitterâ€¦ For god sake thatâ€™s a huge risk with our luck.â€” â˜… ğ˜ˆğ˜‘ â˜… (@RedAndWhiteAlex) October 26, 2021 â€” R.I.P Arsenal (@abhinavsing157) October 26, 2021 if martinelli doesnâ€™t start we riotâ€” SD (@rj3_cr) October 26, 2021 Suspected thisâ€” Inner peace (@peaceofinside) October 26, 2021 Cringeâ€” YKADOA (@YKadoa999) October 26, 2021 He just doesn't care about their developmentâ€” SMGâ¸'Â²â¸ (@GaluweroIII) October 26, 2021 The post 'Thatâ€™s a huge risk': Some Arsenal fans are sceptical over Arteta's reported game plan tonight appeared first on HITC.

title: 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram
creator: Amir Mir
description: Tottenham Hotspur fans have reacted on Twitter to Dele Alliâ€™s Instagram story, where he is seemingly doing more fitness and strength work. Throughout the summer,... The post 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Marc Atkins/Getty Images Tottenham Hotspur fans have reacted on Twitter to Dele Alliâ€™s Instagram story, where he is seemingly doing more fitness and strength work. Throughout the summer, Spurs fans have seen Alli post various videos and images of him putting in the hard yards away from the pitch â€“ in the hope that things change for him out on the pitch. Dele via Instagram stories: "" pic.twitter.com/WkX2vKidpNâ€” The Spurs Web (@thespursweb) October 25, 2021 Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce Forâ€¦ ROONEY?!BridTV6077Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce Forâ€¦ ROONEY?!886387886387center13872 But, it then frustrates them that they arenâ€™t seeing the results out on the field of play. Thatâ€™s the case once again, as he is now out of the first-team picture once again in North London. It does seem as though Spurs fans would rather see the end results on the field, rather than what Alli is doing outside of it. It doesnâ€™t help Alliâ€™s cause when his former boss â€“ Jose Mourinho â€“ calls him out for being â€˜lazyâ€™ in training, itâ€™s probably a tag he wonâ€™t be able to shake-off unless he starts putting the ball into the back of the net again. Alliâ€™s career, towards the back end of Mauricio Pochettinoâ€™s reign, during large parts of Mourinhoâ€™s tenure, and now under Nuno, has done nothing but go backwards. If the attack-minded midfielder could find an answer, he would no doubt bottle it up and use it every time he was in trouble. The issue facing Alli here is that it does seem as though he is on his last legs in North London. If he isnâ€™t able to secure his first-team place under Nuno, then it wouldnâ€™t be a surprise to see him leave and don the colours of another club â€“ probably as early as the winter transfer window. Here is a selection of Spurs fans reacting to Alliâ€™s IG post: Does all this lifting, should spend more time on the training pitchesâ€” jack (@fin52624815) October 25, 2021 his fitness isnâ€™t the issue itâ€™s his footballing abilityâ€” Harleyâ€ (@thfcharl) October 25, 2021 Another goal contribution for dele fcâ€” J (@thfcjxmie) October 25, 2021 The new face of PR Merchantsâ€” Â³ (@3Kimpembe) October 25, 2021 He is that guy who taking photo in gym and then leave whitout workoutâ€” BatmanWhoLaughs (@BatmanWhoLaugh7) October 25, 2021 Full time gym lad part time footballerâ€” I prefer not to speak. (@footyXupdate) October 25, 2021 pic.twitter.com/gjRFmiUhs9â€” James Tierney (@MrJamesTierney) October 25, 2021 Heâ€™s literally gonna be the same why is he doing thisâ€” kelly (@locelsoisdaddy) October 25, 2021 He is always at the gym and on the pitch we donâ€™t see any results â€” Imran dior â™• (@imrandaboss) October 26, 2021 getting fit for newcastle in January siuuuuâ€” Big Poppa (@godwinobiakor_) October 25, 2021 Whatâ€™s the point?â€” Jay Read (@simplyjambo) October 25, 2021 Please stop https://t.co/PFoSgsJJtEâ€” Mike (@THFCMikey) October 25, 2021 Never wouldâ€™ve thought his ability would be a bigger issue than his fitness https://t.co/csKS0K1GXMâ€” Raffaad (@raffaad23) October 25, 2021 The post 'Please stop': Some Spurs fans react to what Dele Alli's put on Instagram appeared first on HITC.

title: Solskjaer expected to remain in charge of Man Utd
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to remain in charge as Manchester United manager despite their heavy defeat at the hands of Liverpool.
full_description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is expected to remain in charge as Manchester United manager despite their heavy defeat at the hands of Liverpool. The feeling within the club is that while the result was bitterly disappointing and painful for everyone, the immediate focus is on improving after picking up one point from their last four Premier League games. United's next two Premier League matches are against Tottenham and Manchester City, both live on Sky Sports , and they also face Atalanta in the Champions League next week. But despite their poor results and huge external speculation, there is no suggestion from inside the club that Solskjaer's job is under threat at this point. Sky in Italy is reporting that former Chelsea manager Antonio Conte has been in contact with United about taking over should they decide to make a change. However, Sky Sports News understands that there has been no contact between the parties. Solskjaer called the 5-0 defeat to Liverpool - their heaviest home defeat in this fixture - his "darkest day" as United manager. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player The Norwegian was however adamant that the club are close to achieving success after he was asked if he was still the right man to lead the team. "We've come too far as a group and we're too close to give up now," he said on Sunday. "I've heard nothing else [about a potential departure]. This is the lowest I've been, but as I've said, I accept the responsibility. "I do believe in myself, I do believe that I am getting close to what I want with the club, I think what we've done, what I've seen, the development, of course, the results lately haven't been good enough. But I've got to keep strong and I do believe in what we've been doing, the coaching staff and the players." Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Solskjaer now faces the huge task of picking up his squad and staff ahead of their trip to Tottenham on Saturday Night Football . United are seventh in the Premier League after nine games, eight points behind leaders Chelsea, while Spurs are one point and one place above them in the table. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player Gary Neville said he expected the club to stick with his former team-mate for at least the remainder of the season when debating Solskjaer's position with Jamie Carragher. "If this was in the immediate post-Sir Alex Ferguson era, Ole would be under massive pressure tonight," Neville said on Sunday. "But I think the club will hold their nerve. I don't think they have planned for a new manager this season. I think they will sit with him until the end of the season. There will be a massive outcry from fans and media that Ole should be sacked and I can understand that after that game. It was a monstrously bad day and it takes some recovery from. "The reason the board will stay stable is because of what happened with Jose Mourinho, with Louis van Gaal. They will not bring in a hitman again to try and do a job for a couple of seasons. Jose was the best manager in the world when he came here and it didn't work out. Please use Chrome browser for a more accessible video player "Antonio Conte's available but I would not bring him in. I do not think he is a fit. I sacked a manager last season and it was the wrong thing to do. I should have waited until the end of the season, let it breathe, and I think that's what Manchester United will do." It does not get much easier; United face a formidable set of fixtures over the next six weeks as they look to keep pace in the Premier League and ensure Champions League qualification, with Chelsea, Arsenal, Tottenham and the Manchester derby looming domestically. October 30: Tottenham (a) - Premier League, kick-off 5.30pm, live on Sky Sports November 2: Atalanta (a) - Champions League, kick-off 8pm November 6: Man City (h) - Premier League, kick-off 12.30pm, live on Sky Sports November 20: Watford (a) - Premier League, kick-off 3pm November 23: Villarreal (a) - Champions League, kick-off 5.45pm November 28: Chelsea (a) - Premier League, kick-off 4.30pm, live on Sky Sports December 2: Arsenal (h) - Premier League, kick-off 8.15pm Another Saturday, another chance to win Â£250,000 with Super 6. Play for free, entries by 3pm.

full_description: Der FC Bayern MÃ¼nchen bastelt schon jetzt am Kader der Zukunft. Offenbar spielt dabei auch ein sÃ¼ndteurer Kolumbianer eine Rolle - sagt zumindest ein Insider. MÃ¼nchen - Der FC Bayern steht in den kommenden Jahren wohl wieder vor einem kleinen Umbruch. Topstars wie Manuel Neuer (35), Robert Lewandowski (33) oder Thomas MÃ¼ller (32) werden nicht mehr ewig spielen kÃ¶nnen, es braucht deshalb bald neue Sterne am MÃ¼nchner FuÃŸball-Himmel. Manch einen hat man ohnehin schon im Kader. Es gilt als ausgemachte Sache, dass Jamal Musiala eines Tages in die MÃ¼ller-FuÃŸstapfen treten soll, in der Defensive hat man mit Tanguy Nianzou auÃŸerdem schon lÃ¤ngst einen Spieler verpflichtet, dem Insider eines Tages die Weltklasse zutrauen. Es wÃ¤chst also wieder etwas heran an der SÃ¤bener StraÃŸe. Und trotzdem ist man natÃ¼rlich auch auf der Suche nach externen VerstÃ¤rkungen. Vor allem in der Offensive wollen die Bayern dem Vernehmen nach aktiv werden. Warum? Weil sich bei Kingsley Coman die Anzeichen verdichten, dass er den Verein mÃ¶glicherweise schon bald verlassen kÃ¶nnte. Der Tempodribbler hat seinen Vertrag, der im Sommer 2023 auslÃ¤uft, bislang nicht verlÃ¤ngert. Offenbar sind die Vorstellungen in Sachen Gehalt bei den verhandelnden Parteien zu unterschiedlich. Ein Wechsel im kommenden Sommer gilt nach aktuellem Stand deshalb als wahrscheinlich. Klar ist: Sollte Coman gehen, braucht es hochkarÃ¤tigen Ersatz. Leroy SanÃ© und Serge Gnabry sind an guten Tagen zwar Weltklasse, aber: NatÃ¼rlich kÃ¶nnen sie nicht alle Spiele in einer Saison bestreiten. DarÃ¼ber hinaus schlagen sich beide immer wieder mit Verletzungen herum - aufgrund ihres Tempo-Spiels ist das nicht einmal verwunderlich. Wer kÃ¶nnte also Coman ersetzen, falls sich der Franzose aus MÃ¼nchen verabschieden sollte? Ein Transfer-Insider bringt nun einen Namen ins Spiel, der in der Vergangenheit schon das eine oder andere Mal gehandelt wurde: Luis Diaz. Nicolo Schira behauptet auf seinem Twitter-Kanal, dass aktuell viele europÃ¤ische Klubs ein Auge auf den Kolumbianer vom FC Porto geworfen haben. Der 24-JÃ¤hrige prÃ¤sentiert sich vor allem in der laufenden Saison in bestechender Form: In zwÃ¶lf Partien (portugiesische Liga und Champions League) kommt der linke FlÃ¼gelspieler auf sieben Tore und eine Vorlage. Ein Wert, der so manchen Interessenten auf den Plan ruft. Laut Transfer-Guru Schira seien Newcastle, Chelsea, Real Madrid und eben der FC Bayern an Diaz interessiert. Alle vier Klubs hÃ¤tten sich angeblich beim FC Porto schon nach dem torgefÃ¤hrlichen Offensivmann erkundigt. Wer Diaz haben will, mÃ¼sste aber tief in die Tasche greifen: Laut Schira gibt es eine Ausstiegsklausel in HÃ¶he von 80 Millionen Euro. FÃ¼r das neureiche Newcastle wÃ¤re das wohl kein Problem, schlieÃŸlich hat man nun einen milliardenschweren Scheich im Hintergrund, der den Magpies mit seinen Geldern richtig teure Beine kaufen kÃ¶nnte. Aber ob die Bayern auf diesen Zug aufspringen? Wohl kaum. Coman hat derzeit einen Marktwert von 55 Millionen Euro, eine AblÃ¶sesumme in dieser Preiskategorie erscheint fÃ¼r den kommenden Sommer bei einem mÃ¶glichen Wechsel als wahrscheinlich. Die Bayern wirtschaften seit jeher Ã¤uÃŸerst gesund, die Corona-Lage hat die Bosse um Sportvorstand Hasan Salihamidzic nochmal aufmerksamer gemacht. Deshalb ist es kaum vorstellbar, dass sie fÃ¼r Diaz derart tief in die Tasche greifen wÃ¼rden. Egal, wohin es den Kolumbianer schlieÃŸlich ziehen wird: Bei Porto ist man prominente und teure AbgÃ¤nge ja schon gewohnt. Jedes Jahr gibt man Spieler fÃ¼r etliche Millionen ab. Trainer Sergio Conceicao sagte Ã¼ber Diaz zuletzt: â€GerÃ¼chte und Nachrichten Ã¼ber Dinge, die passieren oder eben nicht passieren kÃ¶nnen, bereiten mir keine Kopfschmerzen.â€ Ihm dÃ¼rfte aber auch klar sein: Einer seiner besten Spieler wird schon bald woanders aktiv sein. Die Frage ist dann nur: Wann und fÃ¼r wen? Selbst wenn Transfer-Experte Schira Recht haben und der FC Bayern Diaz beobachten sollte: FÃ¼r 80 Millionen Euro werden sie ihn nach aktueller Lage kaum verpflichten. (akl)

The Romanian, winner of the Wimbledon ladiesâ€™ title in 2019, was the player Raducanu idolised while she was growing up in Kent. ReutersEmma Raducanu is being backed to reach the worldâ€™s top ten by Simona Halep[/caption] Twitter / @JudyMurrayWith her Romanian roots, Raducanu idolised Halep growing up[/caption] The pair could potentially meet for the first time if they both progress to the semi-finals of the behind-closed-doors WTA Transylvanian Open in Cluj-Napoca which started on Monday. Like everyone else in the world of tennis, Halep was left amazed by Raducanuâ€™s stunning victory at the US Open last month in New York. But the 30-year-old believes Raducanu â€“ now ranked 23rd in the WTA player list â€“ has the mental strength and playing ability to back up that triumph throughout the rest of her career. Halep said: â€œWhat Emma achieved is unbelievable and itâ€™s all credit to her because she played so well in New York and played so many matches. â€œHer mentality was very strong and also the game. She showed great tennis, was very fast, played close to the baseline and the movement also was great. â€œShe has achieved already a Grand Slam title and is able to achieve everything. description: In der Superbike-WM 2021 ist Axel Bassani die grÃ¶ÃŸte Ãœberraschung. Der Rookie steigerte sich kontinuierlich und fÃ¤hrt seit seinem ersten Podium in Barcelona regelmÃ¤ÃŸig in den Top-5.
full_description: Kaum jemand hÃ¤tte auf Axel Bassani als den Shooting-Star der Superbike-WM 2021 gewettet. Andrea Locatelli steht zwar in der Gesamtwertung vor Bassani, doch als Supersport-Weltmeister im Yamaha-Werksteam konnte man das auch erwarten. Als 17. der Supersport-WM 2020 dockte Bassani als jÃ¼ngster Stammfahrer bei Motocorsa Ducati an. Vom ersten Rennen an war der Italiener ein regelmÃ¤ÃŸiger Top-15-Kandidat, in Misano fuhr er in allen Rennen in die Top-7. In Most folgte das erste Top-5-Ergebnis und in Barcelona das erste Podest. Zuletzt in San Juan war der Ducati-Pilot hinter den Superbike-Stars Razgatlioglu, Redding und Rea der stÃ¤rkste Pilot. Bassani bleibt bodenstÃ¤ndig. Â«Jeder Fahrer hÃ¤lt sich fÃ¼r den grÃ¶ÃŸten Fahrer aller Zeiten. Die Wahrheit ist aber, dass es viele Puzzleteile an der richtigen Stelle benÃ¶tigt, um das erreichen, was man mÃ¶chte. Und das zu schaffen ist extrem schwerÂ», sagte der Motocorsa-Pilot. Â«Ich wechselte von der italienischen Supersport-Serie in die 600er Weltmeisterschaft. Dieser Wechsel fiel mir schwer, obwohl mein Team viel Erfahrung in dieser Kategorie hatte. Ich gab mein Bestes, aber ich war dort nicht richtig aufgehoben. Dann kam Lorenzo auf mich zu und dafÃ¼r, dass er mir die Chance gegeben hat, bin ich ihm sehr dankbar.Â» Mit 199 Punkten ist Bassani WM-Neunter und liegt nur 14 Punkte hinter Kawasaki-Werkspilot Alex Lowes sowie GRT Yamaha-Ass Garrett Gerloff, der ein Werksmotorrad fÃ¤hrt. Â«Ich fÃ¼hle mich groÃŸartig mit dem Team, den Jungs in meiner Box und mit der DucatiÂ», verriet Bassani im GesprÃ¤ch mit SPEEDWEEK.com sein Erfolgsgeheimnis. Â«Solche Ergebnisse wie jetzt habe ich nicht erwartet â€“ ich trÃ¤umte von Positionen um Platz 15. Nach dem ersten Test Ã¤nderte sich das schon ein wenig, weil das GefÃ¼hl mit dem Bike passte und das Team gut arbeitete. Mit jedem Rennen machten wir Fortschritte und warum nicht noch bessere Ergebnisse anpeilen? Wir versuchen jetzt, konstant in den Top-7 oder Top-6 zu fahren. Am Bike gibt es ein paar wenige Dinge zu verbessern, aber das Potenzial fÃ¼r starke Ergebnisse ist vorhanden.Â» Motocorsa-Boss Lorenzo Mauri bestÃ¤tigte in San Juan gegenÃ¼ber SPEEDWEEK.com, dass er mit dem 22-JÃ¤hrigen in der kommenden Saison weitermachen will. Schriftlich fixiert ist aber noch nichts. Â«Im Moment konzentriere ich mich noch auf die letzten Saisonrennen, danach werde ich mit meinem Teamchef Ã¼ber die kommende Saison sprechenÂ», sagte Bassani. Â«Unser VerhÃ¤ltnis ist super und ich mÃ¶chte im Team bleiben. Es ist mein erstes Jahr in der Superbike-WM und wir haben gute Resultate erreicht. Um jedem Rennen in den Top-7 zu landen, fehlt uns aber noch die Erfahrung. Mit jedem Rennen verstehen wir unsere MÃ¶glichkeiten besser. Wir steigern uns gemeinsam.Â»

title: Hardik Pandya's Shoulder Injury "Not Serious": Report
description: Hardik Pandya's shoulder injury sustained during the T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan is believed to be a minor one and he is likely to be available for the next game against New Zealand on...
full_description: Flamboyant India all-rounder Hardik Pandya's shoulder injury sustained during the T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan is believed to be a minor one and he is likely to be available for the next game against New Zealand on October 31. Pandya, who did not bowl in the IPL last month, is playing only as a batter right now and scored 11 off 8 balls on Sunday night, looking distinctly uncomfortable against pacers before being hit on the shoulder by a short ball. "Yes, Hardik's scan reports have come and the injury is not very serious. Also the fact that there is a six-day gap between two games gives him enough time to recuperate," a senior BCCI official told PTI on conditions of anonymity. "But obviously, the medical team would wait and watch as to how he shapes up during the training sessions," he added. Pandya had recently said that he would be bowling during the knock-out stages but India's chances hinge on the New Zealand game. Losing the match would seriously jeopardise their prospects of going ahead in the tournament. The games against Scotland, Namibia and Afghanistan are expected to be easy wins for India, Pakistan and New Zealand. Therefore, if India lose to New Zealand, it will hamper their chances of making it to the top two in the group. In this scenario, Pandya's fitness issues have seriously affected India's balance. Promoted In fact, there are questions being raised about chairman of selectors Chetan Sharma assertions that Pandya will be bowling in the IPL to gear up for the World Cup. He didn't bowl an over and the communication on Pandya's fitness status between the team management and selectors seems baffling at this time. There have been conflicting reports about when he would start bowling. Before the Pakistan game, the player said that he would perhaps bowl in the knock-outs but the statement did not look convincing.

title: Udinese: al via campagna abbonamenti per 13 partite
description: Sottoscrizioni da oggi per rimanenti gare alla Dacia Arena
full_description: (ANSA) - UDINE, 26 OTT - Udinese Calcio ha lanciato la campagna abbonamenti 2021/2022 all'insegna del motto "Il mio posto Ã¨ qui". La sottoscrizione prende il via questa mattina alle 10.30 con una prima fase di prelazione dedicata agli abbonati della stagione 2019/2020 che, come recita lo slogan, potranno riprendersi il loro posto per le rimanenti 13 gare da disputarsi alla Dacia Arena. Questo primo segmento della campagna si svolgerÃ  esclusivamente online fino a giovedÃ¬. Dal 29 ottobre al 4 novembre, i vecchi abbonati potranno esercitare il diritto di prelazione sul proprio posto (no cambio posto), oltre che online, anche presso i punti vendita autorizzati Ticketone e all'Udinese Point operativo in Curva Nord. Il 5 novembre (data unica), solo all'Udinese Point della Curva Nord, sarÃ  possibile per i vecchi abbonati scegliere un nuovo posto diverso tra quelli rimasti liberi o liberatisi durante le prime due fasi di prelazione. Dal 9 al 14 novembre, poi, la campagna si completerÃ  aprendo alla vendita libera dei posti ancora disponibili al termine delle fasi di prelazione. Anche quest'anno, Udinese Calcio - informa la societÃ  - ha voluto confermare la propria politica dei prezzi calcolando le tariffe in base al costo dell'abbonamento 19/20 mantenendo cosÃ¬ immutato il rateo. Si rinnovano anche i pacchetti dedicati a sportivi, universitari e la tariffa family dedicata ai nuclei accomunati dalla passione bianconera. Queste tariffe hanno il costo unico di 50 euro per 10 partite (escluse Inter e Milan) e sono sottoscrivibili esclusivamente alla Dacia Arena. (ANSA).

title: Complimenten voor Ajax en Feyenoord: 'Totaalvoetbal uit 1974'
description: Ajax en Feyenoord bewijzen dat het 4-3-3-systeem nog altijd zeer functioneel is in het hedendaagse voetbal. Nog niet zo lang geleden werd gesteld dat die manier van voetballen niet meer zou passen in het moderne voetbal, maar dat is volgens Bert van Marwijk onzin. De oefenmeester ziet ook gelijkenissen tussen het totaalvoetbal uit 1974 en het huidige Ajax.
full_description: 9:53 â€“ Ajax en Feyenoord bewijzen dat het 4-3-3-systeem nog altijd zeer functioneel is in het hedendaagse voetbal. Nog niet zo lang geleden werd gesteld dat die manier van voetballen niet meer zou passen in het moderne voetbal, maar dat is volgens Bert van Marwijk onzin. De oefenmeester ziet ook gelijkenissen tussen het totaalvoetbal uit 1974 en het huidige Ajax. 'Ik heb daar nooit in geloofd en op deze plaats ook gezegd dat we de oplossing niet bij anderen moesten zoeken, maar dat we vooral bij onszelf moesten blijven', schrijft de Nederlandse coach in De Telegraaf over het feit dat Nederlandse clubs over de landsgrenzen zouden moeten kijken ter inspiratie. 'Dan heb ik het vooral over onze eigen normen en waarden die ooit goed genoeg waren om ons aan de top te brengen.' Volgens Van Marwijk is in het voetbal alles al een keer uitgevonden en gedaan. 'Daarom heb ik de afgelopen jaren met enige scepsis gekeken naar al die nieuwe termen zoals Vollgasfussball, Gegenpressung, Laptoptrainer en dat plotselinge gedweep met vijf verdedigers. Het waren meestal slechts nieuwe, interessante termen voor dingen die al lang bestonden of het betrof een formatie die meer dan dertig jaar geleden reeds werd gehanteerd.' Het totaalvoetbal is volgens Van Marwijk ook ontstaan uit een spelersgroep met heel veel kwaliteit, wat hij momenteel ook bij Ajax ziet. 'Het positiespel in balbezit waarbij altijd gezocht wordt naar de vrije man en waar we proberen de Ã©Ã©n tegen Ã©Ã©n in de voorste linie te creÃ«ren. Met lef en zelfvertrouwen aan de bal, tempoversnellingen en individuele hoogstandjes. En bij balverlies die drang om zo snel mogelijk de bal te heroveren en de tegenstander bij de keel te grijpen. Ondanks het feit dat bij Borussia Dortmund een spits loopt die op zijn best is in de omschakeling en met ruimte achter de defensie van de tegenstander.' Volgens Van Marwijk hield Ajax onverstoorbaar vast aan zijn eigen speelwijze en hield dat ook negentig minuten vol. 'Ik zag later in de week Feyenoord met dezelfde uitgangspunten domineren en winnen van een andere Duitse ploeg uit de Bundesliga. Op papier in een 4-3-3 formatie, maar in feite valt er door de voortdurende beweging nauwelijks een stempel op te drukken. Net als in 1974 toen het als totaalvoetbal werd omschreven.'

title: Mourinho cambia i prezzi della Roma: da Pellegrini a Kumbulla ecco le variazioni
description: La gestione della rosa del portoghese ha svalutato alcuni giocatori, come Villar e Diawara, ma di altri ha aumentato invece la valutazione di mercato
full_description: I titolari e i nuovi esuberi. La Roma vive una spaccatura evidente tra i fedelissimi di Mourinho e quelli che ormai non fanno piÃ¹ parte del progetto. Lo Special One ha incassato domenica col Napoli la fiducia totale di Abraham e compagni. Alcuni di loro hanno visto senza dubbio aumentare il loro valore di mercato in questo inizio campionato. Mou ha perÃ² usato il pugno duro contro quei giocatori colpevoli, a suo modo di vedere, della sconfitta rimediata in Norvegia. Reynolds, Kumbulla, Villar, Diawara e Borja Mayoral hanno assistito al pareggio rimediato contro il Napoli dalla tribuna dellâ€™Olimpico. Il messaggio Ã¨ chiaro: fate le valigie. A che prezzo perÃ²? Da Diawara a Reynolds: ecco chi scende Quanto valgono ora infatti i cartellini dei cinque esclusi? Tiago Pinto aveva giÃ  provato la scorsa estate a vendere Diawara e Villar, incontrando delle difficoltÃ  non indifferenti. Ora quanto sarebbe la loro valutazione? Diawara partiva da una valutazione di 12-13 milioni di euro (ben lontana dai 21 valutati ai tempi del suo arrivo), una cifra che il Galatasaray era disposto a offrire anche a settembre. Oggi, a meno di miracoli, la valutazione Ã¨ scesa di almeno 4 milioni . In Inghilterra il guineano ha ancora un minimo mercato ma non sarÃ  facile. Stesso discorso di svalutazione per Villar: lo spagnolo poteva generare una ricca plusvalenza in estate considerato che era stato pagato 4 milioni da Petrachi. Oggi arrivano richieste di prestito, ma probabilmente nessuno scommetterebbe piÃ¹ di 6-7 milioni sullo spagnolo. Il caso piÃ¹ complesso Ã¨ quello relativo a Kumbulla: nell'estate 2020 fu messo a bilancio per 29.5 milioni di euro , a gennaio lo sarÃ  per 18,65 milioni . Inevitabilmente, in inverno potrÃ  andare via solo in prestito o mettendo in conto una minusvalenza considerato che il suo valore Ã¨ sceso sui 15 milioni. Identico discorso per lâ€™americano Reynolds, strappato alla Juventus al termine di un lungo duello di mercato. Oltre sei milioni, oggi nessuno almeno in Italia ne spenderebbe la metÃ . Discorso diverso per Mayoral che non sarÃ  riscattato per 20 milioni ma che non genererÃ  alcuna perdita se non quella relativo allo stipendio. Col Napoli la Roma aveva 54 milioni di cartellino (giÃ  ammortizzati) sugli spalti che perÃ² a gennaio ne potrebbero fruttare al massimo la metÃ . Probabile che alcuni di loro vengano ceduti solo in prestito. E che altri (soprattutto Kumbulla visto il pessimo stato di forma di Smalling) siano costretti a restare per convincere Mourinho. Alla lista si aggiungono Fazio e Santon che continuano la loro vita da turisti per sempre nella capitale. Un duro lavoro per Tiago Pinto che in estate non era riuscito a convincere gli esuberi a prendere altre strade. Oggi, probabilmente, sarebbe piÃ¹ facile. Lâ€™impresa Ã¨ trovare chi li vuole. Pellegrini e i fedelissimi: prezzo che schizza Dallâ€™altra parte della medaglia câ€™Ã¨ la squadra che ha fermata il Napoli e che mantiene il quarto posto in campionato pur senza grandi ricambi. Sono i 13-14 giocatori che Mourinho sta rivalutando tatticamente, mentalmente e anche economicamente. Dopo la debacle della scorsa stagione, ad esempio, erano calate le quotazioni di Ibanez che Ã¨ oggi titolare inamovibile della Roma. Il brasiliano sta vivendo il momento migliore della sua carriera. Arrivato dallâ€™Atalanta per 8 milioni piÃ¹ bonus due anni fa. Oggi ne vale almeno 25, buona parte anche grazie a Mourinho che vede in lui quel profilo alla Burdisso che serve sempre nelle sue squadre. Aumento di prezzo pure per Cristante. Entra in ballo lâ€™Europeo vinto ma non solo. Mourinho non lo toglierebbe mai dal campo e la bella prestazione col Napoli fa capire perchÃ©. Il suo valore Ã¨ tornato ai tempi dellâ€™Atalanta quando fu ceduto alla Roma per 20 milioni piÃ¹ ricchi bonus (per una valutazione complessiva superiore ai 27). Un anno fa era unâ€™impresa arrivare a 15. Ha sempre mantenuto un profilo medio-alto Mancini che perÃ² potrebbe migliorare se dovesse dar seguito alla prestazione di domenica. Entrambi sono attesi da rinnovo e da una maglia azzurra. La vera ciliegina Ã¨ Lorenzo Pellegrini. Il capitano ha raggiunto con Mou la piena maturitÃ  diventando leader tecnico del gruppo. Oggi la clausola da 30 milioni non basterebbe. Il numero 7 ha sposato la Roma con un ricco e lungo contratto e il suo cartellino Ã¨ ormai schizzato verso quota 50 milioni. Altri giocatori che hanno visto riassestare il loro valore di mercato sono Karsdorp e Carles Perez, pur senza strafare. I prossimi? Ci viene facile scommettere su Zaniolo e Abraham ma occhio pure al ritorno di Veretout.

title: IND vs PAK T20 World Cup: Kohli handled defeat with so much grace, shows he is secure person, says Sana Mir
description: Virat Kohli is a "role model" for being an epitome of grace even in defeat which shows that the India captain is a secure individual, feels former Pakistan women's cricket team skipper Sana Mir.
full_description: is a "role model" for being an epitome of grace even in defeat which shows that the India captain is a secure individual, feels former Pakistan women's cricket team skipper Sana Mir. India lost to Pakistan for the first time in an ICC global event by 10 wickets in the opening Super 12 game of the T20 World Cup on Sunday. However, one of the most endearing images from the match was of the Indian captain hugging winning team hero Mohammed Rizwan. "Virat Kohli handled the defeat with so much grace and I admire his sportsman spirit. It's really good to see the top athletes, who are role models, behaving in the way he did," Mir, a former Pakistan captain, wrote in her column for the ICC's official website. "It shows a lot of security within, and it means they have a lot of confidence to bounce back," she further wrote. Mir won't be surprised if India come back in the tournament with some big wins. "I won't be surprised if India bounce back very quickly and in a big fashion and I hope we can see Pakistan and India play each other again in this tournament." On Pakistan, the legendary woman cricketer said she liked skipper 's attitude of looking immediately towards the next assignment instead of enjoying a prolonged celebration. "With this performance, Pakistan have definitely become one of the favourites for the tournament, but it was heartening to see Babar and Shaheen not get carried away when in front of the media, they were focused on the next games," she said. "It is a great sign that they are staying level-headed and shows the team is going in the right direction," she further wrote.

title: Hardik Pandya injury update: Indian all-rounder announced fit for ICC T20 World Cup game against New Zealand
creator: Rishikesh Sharma
description: Hardik Pandya injury update: The all-rounder has been cleared to face New Zealand after a shoulder injury scare against Pakistan. After all the negativity for Team India after the defeat against Pakistan, India finally got one good news. All-rounder Hardik Pandya has been adjudged fit to face New Zealand on 31 October. The all-rounder gotâ€¦ The post Hardik Pandya injury update: Indian all-rounder announced fit for ICC T20 World Cup game against New Zealand appeared first on The SportsRush.
content: Hardik Pandya injury update: The all-rounder has been cleared to face New Zealand after a shoulder injury scare against Pakistan. After all the negativity for Team India after the defeat against Pakistan, India finally got one good news. All-rounder Hardik Pandya has been adjudged fit to face New Zealand on 31 October. The all-rounder got hurt on his shoulder while batting in the game against Pakistan. He then didnâ€™t take the field and Ishan Kishan came on as his replacement. He was then taken for scans during the game. â€œHardik Pandya was hit on his right shoulder while batting. He has now gone for scans,â€ the BCCI informed earlier. Hardik Pandya plays an important part in giving a balance to team India. He can bat the number six slot, whereas Pandya can also fulfill the role of the 6th bowler in the team. But, the injury of Hardik Pandya has been an everlasting issue. Hardik Pandya Injury update A BCCI official has confirmed that Hardik Pandya is not seriously injured and will be available to play the game against New Zealand. â€œThere is no issue and he is already feeling good. It was just a precautionary scan and the team management didnâ€™t wish to take a chanceâ€ India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is fit and raring to go for the second game against New Zealand..the scan report of the shoulder is in and he is fine..full report on @ANI#HardikPandya #TeamIndia #T20WorldCup #INDvNZ â€” Baidurjo Bhose (@bbhose) October 25, 2021 When Hardik was involved in the T20 World Cup squad, the selectors mentioned that he will bowl in the tournament. However, he didnâ€™t bowl a single ball in IPLâ€™s second leg, whereas he also missed a couple of games. Pandya later informed that he is getting ready to bowl in the knockout stages of the World Cup. â€œThe back is fine, it was jittery, but I wonâ€™t be bowling for now. I want to be able to bowl eventually, closer to the knockouts. The professionals and I both have to take the call about when I can have a bowl.â€ Virat Kohli has also backed the position of Hardik Pandya in the side. â€œ[Hardikâ€™s] physical condition is getting better in terms of being prepared to bowl at least two overs at a certain stage in this tournament. We strongly believe we can make the most of the opportunity at hand till he starts bowling,â€ Virat said earlier. The post Hardik Pandya injury update: Indian all-rounder announced fit for ICC T20 World Cup game against New Zealand appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Derby near miss fires up Kersley to win first Group 1
description: The bitterness of running second in the $2m Group 1 Victoria Derby last year has fuelled Fred Kersleyâ€™s desire to be first past the post on Saturday.
full_description: The bitterness of running second in the $2m Group 1 Victoria Derby last year has fuelled Fred Kersleyâ€™s desire to be first past the post on Saturday. Kersley again came gut-wrenchingly short of a maiden Group 1 success earlier in the carnival when second, by the barest of margins, in the Sir Rupert Clarke Stakes. The 22-year-old jockey will sport the Godolphin blue in two Group 1s on Saturday, including $26 Derby contender Character and Kallos, in the $1.5m Group 1 Coolmore Stud Stakes. Kersley won the Group 2 Danehill Stakes on Kallos last start at Flemington. Character has drawn barrier 10 in the Derby outside of stablemate Alegron, a $9 equal third favourite. â€œIt was frustrating (running second) last year but that adds fuel to the fire and Iâ€™ve found myself on a nice horse in Character,â€œ Kersley said. â€œHe did a nice piece of work on the (Flemington) course proper and gave me a good feel. â€œWeâ€™ll be going into the weekend with some confidence.â€ Character was runner-up in the Geelong Classic last start behind Tutukaka. Unlike a number of his opposition on Saturday the three-year-old son of Teofilo is seasoned for the 2500m challenge, having faced the starter 10 times since January for a win and three minor placings. â€œIt was a great second (Geelong Classic),â€œ Kersley said. â€œArguably if we had have had something to chase down then he goes close to winning. â€œBut heâ€™s really taken me by surprise. Heâ€™s made good progression from each run and although he is deep into a prep he is still progressing. â€œIf we can have a bit of luck in running and have a couple to chase down in the straight then heâ€™ll put in a good showing.â€ Derby favourite Forgot You has drawn perfectly in barrier eight, but second elect Gunstock must overcome gate 15 after scratchings. â€œTheyâ€™re two impressive horses,â€œ Kersley said. â€œTheyâ€™ve had faultless preps going in to Saturday. â€œIf we can have a better run than they do and with a smidgen of luck, thereâ€™s no question about our fella seeing out the distance and with the blinkers on heâ€™ll give a good showing.â€ Kersley has been booked to ride Master Of Wine for Team Hawkes in the Melbourne Cup on Tuesday. Originally published as Fred Kersley fired up to win Victoria Derby after near miss last year To join the conversation, please log in. Don't have an account? Register Join the conversation, you are commenting as Logout Racing Victoria is scrambling to fix a vital CT scanner after an untimely and unforeseen breakdown a week out from the Melbourne Cup. Epsom Handicap winner Private Eye has drawn near the outside for Saturdayâ€™s Golden Eagle but trainer Joe Pride just wants a solid tempo in the $7.5 million feature. When cancer survivor Felicity Krzanic received a slot in the Four Pillars, she settled on a horse renowned for his fighting spirit, just like her close friend Nini Vascotto.

title: Ashes: Ben Stokesâ€™s return will send shivers up Australian spines, says former England captain Michael Vaughan
description: Ben Stokesâ€™s return will send shivers up Australian spines: Michael Vaughan
full_description: Former England captain Michael Vaughan on Tuesday said the return of Ben Stokes for the upcoming Ashes will send shivers up Australian spines. Ben Stokes, who had taken an indefinite break from cricket in July to focus on his mental health. The star all-rounder is also recovering from a second operation on a broken finger. Stokes was not included in coach Chris Silverwood's initial squad for the series. However, the England and Wales Cricket Board said on Monday, however, that Stokes would be available for the series, which is due to start on December 8. "Ben Stokes's return for the Ashes is huge," Vaughan wrote in his column in the Daily Telegraph. "Without him, I would not have given England a chance in Australia; with him, they have a glimmer of hope -- and maybe a bit more than that. "Stokes is the engine of this England team, the guy who powers them. Not only does he contribute massively himself, he lifts the performances of those around him, inspiring, cajoling and driving up standards." Regarded as one of the greatest batting displays in living memory, Stokes hit 135 not out, smashing the ball to all parts of the ground in a virtuoso display that included eight sixes, to give Joe Root's team a thrilling one-wicket victory. "Crucially, he is also a player Australia fear," added Vaughan. "The scars he inflicted on them at Headingley two years ago will not have fully healed, and the sight of him walking out at Brisbane -- or wherever he manages to play his first test -- will send a few shivers up local spines." title: Knightsâ€™ stunning move amid Pearce drama
description: The Newcastle Knights have revealed the return of the clubâ€™s favourite son as Andrew Johns joined the club as a coaching consultant.
full_description: The Newcastle Knights have revealed the return of the clubâ€™s favourite son as Andrew Johns joined the club as a coaching consultant. Johns, who had been working with the Parramatta Eels spine over the past two Covid affected seasons, is one of the most sought after names to assist the development of halves. Catch all the ICC T20 World Cup action live & exclusive to Fox Cricket, available on Kayo. New to Kayo? Start your free trial today. He has been widely credited with the development of Eels halfback Mitchell Moses into a genuine star, including making his Origin debut for the NSW Blues in 2021. But amid word that Knights halfback Mitchell Pearce is set to walk away from the club to replace former NRL star James Maloney at Super League club Catalans, Newcastle are in a state of uncertainty over their halves. The Knights do have halves including former Dragon Adam Clune, former Cowboy Jake Clifford and even fullback Kalyn Ponga able to form a new look halves combination, assuming the Pearce deal is made . The Knights trumpeted the decision on Tuesday afternoon, as Knights CEO Philip Gardner praised the homecoming of the eighth rugby league Immortal. â€œHaving Andrew join the staff is a significant moment in the history of our Club,â€ Mr Gardner said. â€œHis Rugby League knowledge is unmatched anywhere in the world and he will be an excellent addition to the team. â€œJoeyâ€™s return marks the beginning of an incredibly exciting period in our Clubâ€™s history and we canâ€™t wait to see him get to work.â€ The 47-year-old will work for the Knights covering the attack and halves two days per week, while continuing his commentary work for Channel 9. Johns is an all-time legend for the Knights, having played 249 games, won premierships in 1997 and 2001, won three Dally M Medals and has the fifth most points in Australian rugby league history at 2176. He played his entire career, apart from three games he played on loan to the Warrington Wolves in the UK Super League in 2005, for the Knights. The news comes in the middle of the Pearce drama as coach Adam Oâ€™Brien told The Daily Telegraph that nobody at the Knights had â€œheard a single sentenceâ€ from Pearce or his manager. That news was met with criticism from Channel 7â€™s Michelle Bishop who said Oâ€™Brien trying to plan to keep Pearce would â€œbe his downfallâ€ . Fox Sports said that the Knights were attempting to get a transfer fee for Pearce to make the deal. Johns is not afraid to speak his mind however. Last month he said Pearce should leave the Knights for Catalans. Johns also said he wouldnâ€™t have picked Moses for the Blues despite being both an assistant under NSW coach Brad Fittler and Mosesâ€™ mentor at Parramatta at the time. He did however defend Moses after the Bluesâ€™ Origin III loss. Speaking to news.com.au before the 2021 season, Moses said that Johns played a huge role in the development of the Eelsâ€™ spine, despite being locked out of training sessions in 2020. â€œItâ€™s outstanding. Heâ€™s one of the best halfbacks to play the game in my eyes and I looked up to him as a young kid so to be working with him at the moment is something special,â€ Moses said at the time. It seems that Parramattaâ€™s loss is Newcastleâ€™s gain. A former NSW Origin player who was banned for steroids is on the comeback trail now that a barrier has been removed by the NRL. The Knights have been accused of failing to tell the whole story about the rumours surrounding Mitchell Pearce and Luke Brooks. Peter Vâ€™landys has been instrumental in pulling the NRL through two Covid-ravaged seasons, but this comment left fans scratching their heads.
