title: SaarbrÃ¼ckens GÃ¼nther-Schmidt - â€Dann gewinnen wir eben gegen Waldhof und Lautern!â€œ
description: Eigentlich ist Drittligist SaarbrÃ¼cken auf einem guten Weg, nur zweimal in Folge gewinnen konnte der FCS bisher noch nicht. Gelingt das nun?Foto: Andreas Schlichter
full_description: Besiegt SaarbrÃ¼cken den Doppel-Sieg-Fluch in den Derby-Wochen? Eigentlich ist Drittligist SaarbrÃ¼cken auf einem guten Weg. Nach dem 1:1 gegen die MÃ¼nchener LÃ¶wen steht der FCS mit 21 ZÃ¤hlern im oberen Tabellenfeld â€“ in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he zu den direkten AufstiegsplÃ¤tzen. Trotzdem ist die Stimmung gedÃ¤mpft! Lesen Sie auch Nachgehakt Die Liga der Trainer ohne einen Titel! Nach der Entlassung von Mark van Bommel gibt es keinen Titel-Trainer mehr in der Liga. Grund: Der FCS konnte bisher nie zwei Spiele in Folge gewinnen. Am Wochenende bewahrte StÃ¼rmer Julian GÃ¼nther-Schmidt (27) den FCS mit seinem verwandelten Elfmeter sogar vor einer Pleite! Am Samstag gehtâ€˜s fÃ¼r den FCS nach Mannheim, danach kommt Lautern â€“ ein guter Zeitpunkt fÃ¼r zwei Siege, findet auch GÃ¼nther-Schmidt! Auch Interessant Der Offensivmann zu BILD: â€Mir ist das bisher gar nicht aufgefallen, aber dann wÃ¤re doch jetzt ein guter Zeitpunkt, damit anzufangen und die nÃ¤chsten beiden Spiele zu gewinnen.â€œ Dabei hat er auch die Tabelle im Blick, fÃ¼hrt aus: â€Mit Mannheim und Lautern kommen zwei direkte Konkurrenten, die wir mit Siegen weiter hinter uns lassen wollen â€“ noch dazu sind es zwei Prestige-Duelle, da ist die Motivation umso grÃ¶ÃŸer. Jeder, der bei uns spielt hat mitbekommen, was diese Spiele fÃ¼r die Fans bedeuten.â€œ FÃ¼r ihn persÃ¶nlich sind es die ersten beiden Derbys. Hintergrund: Beim 5:0 gegen Mannheim und 1:2 in Lautern in der RÃ¼ckrunde fehlte er wegen Corona. Fieser Lichtschalter-Moment Unangenehme Szene bei Flick-Aus-VerkÃ¼ndung 06:13 Quelle: Amazon Prime Teilen Twittern per Mail versenden â€Ich freue mich schon sehr auf die Spiele. Solange wir gewinnen, ist es mir egal, wer die Tore macht.â€œ Doch damit die auch fallen kÃ¶nnen, braucht es Chancen. Ein Knackpunkt an dem der FCS mit Trainer Uwe Koschinat (50) noch arbeiten muss. Der Pforzheimer weiter: â€Wir mÃ¼ssen unsere guten Phasen konstanter im gesamten Spiel zeigen und noch dominanter auftreten, wenn wir das hinkriegen, kÃ¶nnen wir in der Liga jeden schlagen!â€œ

title: Man Utd include PL boss on four-man shortlist to replace Ole
creator: Joe Williams
description: The under-fire Man Utd boss called â€¦ The post Man Utd include PL boss on four-man shortlist to replace Ole appeared first on Football365.
content: Man Utd have included Leicester City boss Brendan Rodgers on a four-man shortlist to replace Ole Gunnar Solskjaer at Old Trafford, according to reports. The Red Devilsâ€™ 5-0 drubbing against Liverpool could have immediate ramifications for manager Solskjaer, with the Manchester Evening News reporting he could be sacked before Unitedâ€™s next game at Tottenham on Saturday. The under-fire Man Utd boss called Sundayâ€™s home defeat to Jurgen Kloppâ€™s team the â€œdarkest dayâ€ of his near three years in the dugout, admitting they had hit â€œrock bottomâ€. Topical Top Ten: Manchester Unitedâ€™s worst Premier League defeats Liverpoolâ€™s biggest ever Old Trafford win compounded poor recent performances and will test the United hierarchyâ€™s support of a man they gave a new three-year deal to over the summer. Those in the corridors of power are well aware of how damaging Sundayâ€™s loss was and, despite some dissatisfied murmurings beginning to seep out of the dressing room, there is yet to be a concrete update on Solskjaer. However, The Sun claim the Man Utd hierarchy are lining up potential replacements as they consider Solskjaerâ€™s future at Old Trafford. It is understood that the board have â€˜drawn up a four-man shortlistâ€™ and have â€˜sounded outâ€™ Antonio Conte and Zinedine Zidane as their top targets. Man Utd want to know if either of the pair â€˜would be interested in the jobâ€™ with Ajax boss Erik Ten Hag and Leicester City manager Brendan Rodgers â€˜also on the shortlistâ€™. The report adds that the board have realised they â€˜can no longer ignore the shocking downturn in form and resultsâ€™ but that â€˜a sudden upturn in results could yet save Solskjaerâ€™. Criticism of the dreadful display against Liverpool has been widespread, with left-back Luke Shaw â€“ so impressive last season and for England at Euro 2020 â€“ holding his hands up. â€œNot good enough,â€ Shaw said. â€œI know of course this game is a team sport, a team game, but I think as individuals we need to be accountable of some of the performances today. â€œAnd thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m here now. Iâ€™m not hiding in there (in the dressing room), not speaking. â€œI come out, I say wasnâ€™t good enough and I speak on behalf of myself, not the team. Iâ€™m accountable for my performance and it wasnâ€™t good enough. â€œLike I said, Iâ€™m not here to speak about the team. We know we can be better but for me also I need to be better than I was today. Thatâ€™s why I come here now, not hide, speak to you, and tell it how it is.â€ Â  The post Man Utd include PL boss on four-man shortlist to replace Ole appeared first on Football365.

title: SA vs WI T20 Head to Head Records | South Africa vs West Indies T20I Stats | Dubai T20I
creator: Dixit Bhargav
description: SA vs WI T20 Head to Head: The SportsRush presents for you the Head to Head statistics for the SA vs WI T20 World Cup match. The 18th match of the ongoing ICC T20 World Cup 2021 will be played between South Africa and West Indies in Dubai today. With both South Africa and Westâ€¦ The post SA vs WI T20 Head to Head Records | South Africa vs West Indies T20I Stats | Dubai T20I appeared first on The SportsRush.
content: SA vs WI T20 Head to Head: The SportsRush presents for you the Head to Head statistics for the SA vs WI T20 World Cup match. The 18th match of the ongoing ICC T20 World Cup 2021 will be played between South Africa and West Indies in Dubai today. With both South Africa and West Indies losing their first Super 12 match against Australia and England respectively, they would be eager to return to winning ways. South Africa, who had defeated defending champions West Indies 3-2 in a five-match series earlier this year, hold a slight advantage less because of their current form and more because of West Indiesâ€™ poor form. With their batting unit registering scores of 130/7, 133/5 and 55 in two warm-up matches and a league match in this tournament, they badly need an archetype T20 innings from at least one of their archetype T20 superstars. As far as their past record is concerned, the Proteas hold an edge on paper as well. Just a few hours until itâ€™s time to RALLY with #MissionMaroon in our second match of the @T20WorldCup! What are you looking forward to most, as WI clash with @OfficialCSA? #WorldChampions pic.twitter.com/PyIUErjX1E â€” Windies Cricket (@windiescricket) October 26, 2021 SA vs WI T20 Head to Head Records Total number of matches played: 15 Matches won by SA: 9 Matches won by WI: 6 Matches played in Asia: 1 (SA 0, WI 1) Matches played at neutral venues: 2 (SA 1, WI 1) Matches played in ICC T20 World Cup: 3 (SA 2, WI 1) SA average score against WI: 157 WI average score against SA: 149 Most runs for SA: 302 (Quinton de Kock) Most runs for WI: 363 (Chris Gayle) Most wickets for SA: 8 (Kagiso Rabada) Most wickets for WI: 15 (Dwayne Bravo) Most catches for SA: 5 (Aiden Markram, Quinton de Kock and David Miller) Most catches for WI: 7 (Andre Fletcher) The last time when South Africa and West Indies had locked horns against each other in a T20I was at the National Cricket Stadium in St Georgeâ€™s in July this year. After captain Temba Bavuma had won the toss and chose to bat, South Africa had put on board 168/4 in 20 overs on the back of a match-winning 128-run partnership between Quinton de Kock (60) and Aiden Markram (70). Despite opening batter Evin Lewis scoring 52 (34), West Indies had ended losing by 25 runs. title: Nate Diaz to â€˜QUIT UFCâ€™ for Â£10m Jake Paul fight and then onto Conor McGregor trilogy in boxing ring, claims ex-MMA star
creator: Jack Figg
description: NATE DIAZ will leave the UFC after his contract expires to fight Jake Paul for up to Â£10million, his former opponent predicted. Diaz has just one bout left on his current UFC contract and recently hinted at facing Tony Ferguson. So far, he is yet to extend his deal and Josh Thompson believes the American [â€¦]
content: NATE DIAZ will leave the UFC after his contract expires to fight Jake Paul for up to Â£10million, his former opponent predicted. Diaz has just one bout left on his current UFC contract and recently hinted at facing Tony Ferguson. GettyConor McGregor is 1-1 with UFC rival Nate Diaz[/caption] GettyYouTuber star-turned 4-0 boxer Jake Paul[/caption] So far, he is yet to extend his deal and Josh Thompson believes the American is eyeing a lucrative boxing switch to fight Paul over a trilogy with Conor McGregor. Thompson, 43, said on his Weighing In podcast: â€œHeâ€™s leaving the UFC, heâ€™s fighting Jake Paul. Just stop, OK. â€œThis is his last fight, heâ€™s not fighting in the UFC anymore. Heâ€™s going to leave and heâ€™s going to fight Jake Paul. â€œHeâ€™s just trying to get a fight to get out the door, heâ€™s done with MMA. He knows that fight is going to make him double then heâ€™d make [against McGregor]. â€œConorâ€™s not that draw anymore that he once was. Conor canâ€™t get out of his contract, heâ€™s on an eight or ten fight deal I believe. â€œSo heâ€™s stuck with the UFC forever. Speaking from a Nate point of view, I think Nateâ€™s going to leave and end up fighting Jake Paul in boxing.â€ Most read in Boxing HE'LL PAUL IT OFF Jake Paul tipped to beat Tommy Fury by UFC legend Michael Bisping FATE OF THE FURY-OUS Tyson Fury to return in March against Dillian Whyte or Joe Joyce EU CAN'T BE SERIOUS! Eubank Jr facing huge bill after Â£66k eBay bid on microwave he signed TY-ME ALMOST UP? Paris Fury reveals when husband Tyson will retire from boxing LOVE STRUCK Paris Fury hits back at claims she is only with husband Tyson 'for the money' BRIT SPECIAL Furyâ€™s next fight will be in March against Whyte or Joyce, says promoter Arum Diaz, 37, beat McGregor, 33, in March 2016 but lost the rematch in a modern classic just five months later. The trilogy decider is yet to materialise despite the pair regularly goading each other online. But Thompson, the only man to ever KO Diaz in the UFC, believes the rubber match could take place in the boxing ring. And he claimed his old rival could end up making over TRIPLE the money to fight YouTuber-turned 4-0 boxer Paul opposed to McGregor. Thompson said: â€œI know he can make any more from between $10 to $15million (Â£10m) to do that one fight versus him having to fight Conor and make $2million, maybe $4million (Â£2.9m). â€œWhy? When he can fight one time in boxing against somebody who heâ€™s got a lot more experience against and against somebody his brother knows. â€œIf Nate goes and beats Jake Paul, then I can see Dana saying, â€˜OK, letâ€™s fight Nate in boxingâ€™. I couldnâ€™t see him doing it before, he has to beat Jake Paul first. â€œIf he beats Jake Paul I can see him riding Conor in to be like, â€˜Nate and [Conor] in boxing makes senseâ€™. â€œItâ€™s a trilogy fight but not a trilogy fight because itâ€™s in boxing not in MMA.â€

content: MercoledÃ¬ 27 ottobre alle 20:45 la Roma giocherÃ  il suo turno infrasettimanale in Sardegna contro il Cagliari. Per la decima giornata di Serie A, Mourinho non rinuncerÃ  ai suoi titolarissimi nonostante l'impegno di domenica...
full_description: MercoledÃ¬ 27 ottobre alle 20:45 la Roma giocherÃ  il suo turno infrasettimanale in Sardegna contro il Cagliari. Per la decima giornata di Serie A, Mourinho non rinuncerÃ  ai suoi titolarissimi nonostante l'impegno di domenica contro il Milan. JosÃ© Mourinho nel post Roma-Napoli , ha annunciato la formazione che scenderÃ  in campo contro il Cagliari. Quindi ecco che in porta ci sarÃ  Rui Patricio con davanti Karsdorp, Mancini, Ibanez e Vina. Cerniera di centrocampo composta da Cristante e Veretout. In attacco Abraham sostenuto da Mkhitaryan, Pellegrini e Zaniolo. Mazzarri non recupera Dalbert e dovrÃ  fare a meno dell'ex Strootman, e di Nandez e Caceres. Le tante assenze costringeranno l'ex allenatore del Napoli a scelte obbligate. Dentro dunque Zappa e Grassi. In difesa stringe i denti e ci sarÃ  Godin. In attacco l'ex Lazio Keita sosterrÃ  il capitano Joao Pedro. Altra panchina per Pavoletti. Cagliari (3-5-2): Cragno; Godin, Ceppitelli, Carboni; Zappa, Grassi, Marin, Deiola, Lykogiannis; Keita, Joao Pedro. Allenatore: Mazzarri. Roma (4-2-3-1): Rui Patricio; Karsdorp, Mancini, Ibanez, Vina; Veretout, Cristante; Zaniolo, Pellegrini, Mkhitaryan; Abraham. Allenatore: Mourinho. La partita fra Cagliari e Roma sarÃ  visibile soltanto su Dazn. description: Es war eine irre Aufholjagd, die ihr zum Sieg beim Weltcup-Auftakt in SÃ¶lden verhalf. Der neue Freund von Ski-Star Mikaela Shiffrin hatte daran groÃŸen Anteil.
full_description: Es war eine irre Aufholjagd, die ihr zum Sieg beim Weltcup-Auftakt in SÃ¶lden verhalf. Der neue Freund von Ski-Star Mikaela Shiffrin hatte daran groÃŸen Anteil. SÃ¶lden - Sie ist einfach die Beste ihres Fachs. Die Ski-Queen Mikaela Shiffrin hat direkt zum Start der neuen Wintersport-Saison ein dickes Ausrufezeichen gesetzt und den ersten Sieg geholt. Dass die US-Amerikanerin gleich zum Auftakt der Olympia-Saison im nervenaufreibenden Riesenslalom von SÃ¶lden ihren 70. Weltcup-Sieg feiern konnte, hatte sie auch dem neuen Mann an ihrer Seite zu verdanken. Shiffrin hat erst vor kurzem ihr Liebesgeheimnis mit dem norwegischen Ski-RennlÃ¤ufer Aleksander Aamodt Kilde gelÃ¼ftet. In SÃ¶lden jubelte ihr neuer Freund an der Strecke - zuvor gab er seiner Heldin aber wertvolle Tipps. â€Ich dachte immer, einen Freund hier zu haben, lenke nur ab. Aber er gibt mir so viel Motivation und Energie, es ist einfach tollâ€œ, erzÃ¤hlte Shiffrin im ARD-Interview. BeflÃ¼gelt von ihrem ganz besonderen â€Fanâ€œ entriss die Olympiasiegerin im packenden Finale auf dem Rettenbachferner Weltmeisterin Lara Gut-Behrami noch den Sieg. â€Es ist wunderschÃ¶n einen Menschen an der Seite zu haben, mit dem man Ã¼ber alles reden kannâ€œ, sagte sie. Nicht nur, aber auch Ã¼ber den Beruf. Kilde, Gesamtweltcupsieger 2020, hatte ihr vor dem zweiten Lauf empfohlen, alle Vorsicht Ã¼ber Bord zu werfen und â€mehr Gasâ€œ zu geben. SchlieÃŸlich war der oft launige Gletscher diesmal ein perfekter Untergrund. Shiffrin folgte dem Rat - und lag am Ende 0,14 Sekunden vor Gut-Behrami. â€Das war eine absolute Demonstration der StÃ¤rke. Es ist ein Traum, ihr zuschauen zu dÃ¼rfenâ€œ, schwÃ¤rmte ARD-Experte Felix Neureuther . ${caption} ${footer} ${time} 70 Siege - â€das ist unglaublichâ€œ, sagte Shiffrin, â€ich bin wirklich stolzâ€œ. Bei der Siegerehrung kÃ¤mpfte sie mit den TrÃ¤nen. Seit dem Tod ihres Vaters Jeff im Februar 2020 hatten sich bei der langjÃ¤hrigen Dominatorin Zweifel breit gemacht, daran Ã¤nderten auch die vier WM-Medaillen vor acht Monaten wenig .Vor SÃ¶lden habe sie sich gefragt: â€Kann ich wirklich wieder gewinnen? Kann ich mit dem Feuer fahren, das ich vorher hatte?â€œ, berichtete die 26-JÃ¤hrige. Doch bei all der NervositÃ¤t sei sie sich sicher gewesen bei dem, was sie tat - auch dank Kilde. Der 29-jÃ¤hrige Norweger verzichtet nach seinem Kreuzbandriss vor neun Monaten noch auf einen Start und konzentriert sich auf die ersten Speed-Rennen in Lake Louise (Kanada) Ende November. Das verschaffte Shiffrin ein einmaliges Erlebnis: ein Rennen samt Sieg vor den Augen ihres Freundes. â€Es ist etwas Besonders, das wird wahrscheinlich nie wieder in meiner Karriere passieren. Ich bin so aufgeregt, dass er hier istâ€œ, verriet Shiffrin. Vielleicht kann es Kilde ja doch noch einmal einrichten, bevor er sich wieder selbst die Bretter anschnallt. Dass er seiner Freundin GlÃ¼ck bringt, ist nur allzu offensichtlich. (ck/sid) Rubriklistenbild: Â© ESPA Photo Agency via www.imago-images.de

title: Rafael Benitez could turn against Everton owner Farhad Moshiri as he and Marcel Brands fail to get the most out of transfers, warns Simon Jordan
creator: Mitul Samji
description: Simon Jordan believes Everton manager Rafael Benitez could turn on club owner Farhad Moshiri after their surprise 5-2 home defeat against Watford.Â  After a promising start to the season, the Merseysidersâ€™ recent form has dipped with just one win in their last six matches in all competitions. Big questions are being asked over the clubâ€™s [â€¦]
content: Simon Jordan believes Everton manager Rafael Benitez could turn on club owner Farhad Moshiri after their surprise 5-2 home defeat against Watford.Â  After a promising start to the season, the Merseysidersâ€™ recent form has dipped with just one win in their last six matches in all competitions. Everton capitulated completely at Goodison Park last weekendAFP Big questions are being asked over the clubâ€™s transfer policy with the side severely weakened by injuries to key players. Former Liverpool midfielder Danny Murphy said: â€œTheyâ€™ve started really well with the 11 or 12 players that got them into that position and theyâ€™ve lost three or four of their best players in Dominic Calvert-Lewin, Richarlison, Abdoulaye Doucoure and Yerry Mina. â€œThat is not an excuse for the Watford performance but theyâ€™ve lost a bit of confidence in recent weeks. I think when youâ€™re missing your two best goalscorers and youâ€™re feeling like you have to defend a lot more in games, itâ€™s harder. â€œThe way Rafa works and the kind of structure he wants in a team generally takes a little while to get the point across. Murphy is relaxed about Everton despite their recent bad formGetty â€œI donâ€™t worry for Everton. I think there will be improvements when those lads get back, theyâ€™re crucial to the way they play of course. But it was disappointing because they capitulated.â€ However, Jordan believes if owner Moshiri and director of football Marcel Brands donâ€™t back the manager, Benitez could turn against them if he doesnâ€™t see his roster strengthened. Jordan said: â€œWill there be a departure from the congenial, mild-mannered Benitez who is happy with his lot at Everton to the person that is not getting quite enough support that weâ€™ve seen in other incarnations that will suddenly start briefing the media against the owner? I wouldnâ€™t be surprised if that came along. â€œMoshiri has not put the money into this team this year in the same way as before because theyâ€™ve been caught by Financial Fair Play. Benitez doesnâ€™t always have the best relationship with club owners and Jordan believes history could repeat itselfAFP â€œThe losses are absolutely enormous for Everton right now. Itâ€™s unfathomable how much theyâ€™ve lost, some of it because of COVID. But a lot of it is because of the profligacy of their spending regime. â€œWe talk about these wonderful so-called blueprint merchants like Marcel Brands and say five or six years into this project, with this kind of dough, with Everton not knocking on the door of the top sixâ€¦ you have to say itâ€™s his money and he has the right to spend it. â€œThe Everton fans have the right to question it to some extent as itâ€™s their club. But they canâ€™t question how he spends his money.â€

title: Gary Neville on Ole is a logical endpoint for footballâ€™s chumocracy
creator: Ian King
description: Neville has found himself between a â€¦ The post Gary Neville on Ole is a logical endpoint for footballâ€™s chumocracy appeared first on Football365.
content: Gary Neville found himself between a rock and hard place after the match between Liverpool and Manchester United, but why arenâ€™t pundits allowed to declare an interest and pass? It was difficult not to feel a little sympathy for Neville after the match between Manchester United and Liverpool. Regardless of what many would-be Nostradamuses might now claim, few saw Liverpoolâ€™s 5-0 thrashing of United at Old Trafford coming. Most would have predicted a Liverpool win and many may have believed it would be comfortable, but not that many people would have confidently predicted such total Liverpool victory, to the point that they effectively took their collective foot off the pedal and ran the clock down for a full half hour. Certainly not at Old Trafford. In the Sky Sports studio after the match, Jamie Carragher and Graeme Souness took Neville to task, effectively goading him to say that Ole Gunnar Solskjaer should be sacked immediately. Nevilleâ€™s reticence to do so has been widely interpreted as a valiant attempt to stand up for his â€˜mateâ€™ in the face of overwhelming evidence that whatever Solskjaer is doing with half a billion poundsâ€™ worth of â€˜talentâ€™ is not working, and that a change is surely necessary if United are to avoid fading into mid-table obscurity for the first time in three decades. Manchester United are now 7th in the Premier League, the same position that they managed under David Moyes in 2013/14. Itâ€™s closer than some people likely realise. For fully twenty minutes, Neville had to stand alone on the subject, as though he is somehow personally responsible for what is going wrong at Old Trafford. Jamie Carragher felt that Ole should go at the end of this season. Graeme Souness believes that Manchester Unitedâ€™s backroom staff need a complete overhaul. As the minutes passed, Gary was forced into a tighter and tighter corner by the contradictions between what he believes and the evidence of his own eyes. But surely it couldnâ€™t be, that he could sit there and defend a status quo that produced the cataclysmic 90 minutes of football that weâ€™d just all watched together, could it? Souness was excoriating of both Solskjaer and Unitedâ€™s backroom staff, and Gary could only point to Mike Phelanâ€™s ten years of working with Sir Alex Ferguson as mitigation for him being there. It was, in its own way, enthralling television, and the real shame of it was that they had to break away sooner than most of us would have liked for the American Grand Prix in Austen. At times visibly uncomfortable and grasping for words as though they were floating away from him, his arguments sounded increasingly tenuous as time progressed. Itâ€™s not that Neville wasnâ€™t critical of the way in which Manchester United played against Liverpool. Itâ€™s more that he is either putting himself or has been put in a tight situation by having to comment on the shortcomings of someone who we may presume to be a personal friend, and whether they should lose their job over them. Of course, the normal rules do not apply here, as they would to the vast majority of us. For most people, getting sacked or resigning from their job would have ramifications in their personal lives, and this may not be the case to anything like the same extent, if all concerned are already multi-millionaires who live in fancy houses. But it still shouldnâ€™t be difficult to undertstand why Neville would have have found it difficult to say that his friend should be sacked from his job. But this in itself opens up a whole new avenue of questions. If analysts are so close to those that they are expected to talk about, should they even be talking about them in the first place if they canâ€™t answer as frankly as theyâ€™d like to? For years now, broadcasters have increasingly seemed to believe that pundits should be selected because they have prior experience of a club. Jamie Carragher and Graeme Souness are routinely rolled out for Liverpool matches. The same goes for Gary Neville and Manchester United, and for other pundits and other clubs. And that comes at a cost. Itâ€™s quite likely that, if ever a meeting was held at which this was the topic of conversation, a graph would have been pulled out with â€œBanterâ€ on one axis and â€œEngagementâ€ on the other. It is very much in the best interests of broadcasters to provoke controversy, which they can do either directly, through having their anchors ask deliberately provocative questions, or indirectly, just by choosing the most combustible combination of guests that they can. In the case of Gary Neville, there are hoards of people who are sitting at home joining in with the goading, willing Neville to call out his friend for their own amusement, because people in the 21st century are weirdly cruel, like that. But thatâ€™s not to say that post-match coverage should be no more than an assortment people standing at a whiteboard, dryly analysing endless reams of statistics. Televised football coverage should be entertaining because football is, at its heart, entertainment. But at the other end of the spectrum, few viewers would want every round of post-match analysis to be a circle of pundits, all decrying the manager of the losing side of the game theyâ€™ve just watched. It shouldnâ€™t be beyond their ken to be able to make the analysis light but incisive, and honest without ending up as a pile-on aimed at those whoâ€™ve just had a bad day. News reports emerging from Old Trafford are now making much of this talk irrelevant anyway, with speculation intensifying that Solskjaer will not, as has previously been claimed, be given until the end of this season to right the mess at the club. But broadcasters should look again at the chumocracy of punditry, because when it reaches the point that it did after Manchester United vs Liverpool, it might be worth asking the question of whether itâ€™s all gone a little too far. title: Man Utd thumping unsettles Liverpool star, as role under Klopp â€˜confirmedâ€™
creator: Jonny Whitfield
description: One Liverpool star left Old Trafford on Sunday less happy than his team-mates after the 5-0 win over Man Utd, a report has claimed The post Man Utd thumping unsettles Liverpool star, as role under Klopp â€˜confirmedâ€™ appeared first on TEAMtalk.
content: Liverpool defender Joe Gomez has become frustrated after the win over Manchester United made clear his role under Jurgen Klopp, a report has claimed. The 24-year-old has endured a mixed career at Anfield since signing from Charlton in 2015. While he has enjoyed successful spells in the team, he has also had to sit out through injury. Whatâ€™s more, those absences have mostly proved long-term, including ankle and knee problems. Indeed, he sat out the majority of the last campaign. Gomez may be back to full fitness now, but he is again struggling for game time. Virgil van Dijk and Joel Matip have made themselves the first-choice centre-back pairing in the Premier League. However, 90min reports that Gomez learned at Old Trafford on Sunday that he now ranks as fourth-choice behind Ibrahima Konate. That is because summer signing Konate came in to replace Matip as the Reds won a historic game 5-0. The report adds that Gomez had his role under Klopp â€˜confirmedâ€™ by the turn of events. The England international subsequently fears for his role with England if the situation carries on. In fact, 90min adds that Gomez is becoming â€˜increasingly concernedâ€™ and â€˜agitatedâ€™. He reportedly believes he is Englandâ€™s best option in central defence. He was with Gareth Southgateâ€™s squad when he suffered his knee injury last season. title: Major Warm-Up For Australian Open Tennis Cancelled Again Over COVID-19
description: The Kooyong Classic, a major warm-up tournament for the Australian Open, was cancelled on Tuesday, with organisers blaming uncertainty over Covid-19 rules players will face in Melbourne.
full_description: A major warm-up tournament for the Australian Open was cancelled on Tuesday, with organisers blaming uncertainty over Covid-19 rules players will face in Melbourne. It is the second year the Kooyong Classic, normally played in the weeks leading up to the season-opening Grand Slam, has been scrapped because of the coronavirus pandemic. Kooyong president Adam Cossar said he was disappointed the event could not take place in January 2022 but hopes it will return in 2023. "With the great deal of uncertainty over recent months about the arrangements that would be in place in January, it has not been possible to make the best plans to deliver the best and safest sporting (event)," he said in a statement. Players are still awaiting clarification on whether they need to be fully vaccinated to participate at the Australian Open, also in Melbourne, and other tennis tournaments in the country. Such a requirement would cast doubt on nine-time Australian Open champion Novak Djokovic's ability to defend his title -- he is one of many players who have refused to share their vaccination status. A leaked WTA email this week suggested unvaccinated players could take part provided they completed 14 days in hotel quarantine. Double-jabbed players would though enjoy "complete freedom of movement". However, the Premier of Victoria -- the state where the Grand Slam is held -- said he wanted all players to be fully vaccinated. Promoted "All the people who are watching the tennis at the Australian Open, they're going to be double-vaxxed, all the people that work there are going to be double-vaxxed," Dan Andrews told public radio. "It stands to reason that if you want to get into the country to be part of that tournament, then you should be double-vaxxed as well," he added.

title: England has been given a â€˜dangerousâ€™ boost for the Ashes... and Steve Smith is â€˜gladâ€™
description: Australian star Steve Smith says heâ€™s â€œglad personallyâ€ Ben Stokes will be a member of Englandâ€™s touring party for the upcoming Ashes.
full_description: Australian star Steve Smith says heâ€™s â€œglad personallyâ€ Ben Stokes will be a member of Englandâ€™s touring party for the upcoming Ashes. Stokes was not originally included in the 17-player squad list released earlier this month, as he was still recovering from a finger injury sustained during the opening leg of the Indian Premier League. Catch all the ICC T20 World Cup action live & exclusive to Fox Cricket, available on Kayo. New to Kayo? Start your free trial today. The 30-year-old also took time off from the game to focus on his mental health, ruling himself out of Englandâ€™s T20 World Cup campaign. But the English all-rounder will look to help his team bring back the Ashes as he looks forward â€œto seeing my mates and being on the field with themâ€. Smith, who was a first-hand witness to just how destructive Stokes can be in the red-ball format, believes the return of the Englishman is only good news for the upcoming series. â€œI think any teamâ€™s more dangerous when youâ€™ve got someone like Ben Stokes playing,â€ Smith said. Ben Stokes announced he will be joining the England squad for the upcoming Ashes on Australian soil. Picture: Jon Super / AFP Source: AFP â€œIt certainly adds a lot to their depth, but like I said weâ€™re excited and Iâ€™m glad personally that heâ€™s able to be back playing some cricket. â€œIt makes for a really good series.â€ Stokesâ€™ decision to step away from the game for mental health purposes was one that was applauded by many in not just cricket, but the sporting arena in general. He isnâ€™t the first cricketer to take some time off for those reasons, either. Australian stars Glenn Maxwell and Will Pucovski are two other high-profile examples. Maxwell announced he would take a break from cricket for mental health reasons in October 2019. A year earlier, Pucovski stepped away from cricket due to a mental health-related illness and also withdrew from the Australian Test squad in the series against Sri Lanka so he could continue working on his mental health in January 2019. Smith praised the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) for accepting Stokesâ€™ decision and also admitted his delight at seeing society take a progressive outlook on mental health as a whole. â€œI think weâ€™ve seen it a lot more now, the acceptance of people when theyâ€™re not doing well mentally,â€ Smith said. â€œCredit to Ben for being able to make that decision and step away for a bit and make sure heâ€™s right to go out and play and live his life. â€œThereâ€™s more out there sometimes than the game of cricket. â€œFor him to be able to make the decision to step away, and from the acceptance from the ECB and everyone involved, I think that's really important for people going forward.â€ Steve Smith praised the ECB for accepting Stokesâ€™ decision to take a break from cricket for mental health purposes. Picture: Bradley Kanaris / Getty Images Source: Getty Images

title: â€œCricket has become the 2nd most popular sport on the planetâ€: Shane Warne lauds the valuation of two new IPL 2022 teams
creator: Rishikesh Sharma
description: Australian legend Shane Warne has called cricket the second most popular sport after the grand valuation of IPL 2022 teams. Shane Warne was left amused after the two new teams of IPL went for a whopping price. BCCI conducted the bidding ceremony for the two new IPL teams in Dubai on 25 October 2021. Theâ€¦ The post â€œCricket has become the 2nd most popular sport on the planetâ€: Shane Warne lauds the valuation of two new IPL 2022 teams appeared first on The SportsRush.
content: Australian legend Shane Warne has called cricket the second most popular sport after the grand valuation of IPL 2022 teams. Shane Warne was left amused after the two new teams of IPL went for a whopping price. BCCI conducted the bidding ceremony for the two new IPL teams in Dubai on 25 October 2021. The tournament will be played between ten teams from the next season. From the six cities available, the new franchises chose Lucknow and Ahmedabad to be their bases. The RPSG group and CVC Capitals were the successful bidders in the BCCI event. RPSG group were the highest bidders with INR 7090 Cr, whereas CVC Capitals were the second highest with INR 5625 Cr. Lucknow will be the base city of the RPSG Group, whereas Ahmedabad will be of CVC Capitals. There were a total of nine parties involved in the bidding process, but only two of them were successful. Glazers were the lowest bidders with a price of just INR 4000 Cr, but the biggest surprise was Adani Group. Adaniâ€™s were considered the favourites to win the bid, but their bid was way too low comparatively. Shane Warne on IPL team prices Australian legend Shane Warne tweeted to appreciate the effort, whereas he also called Cricket the second biggest sport on the planet. He went on to Twitter and wrote, â€œWow! Congratulations to both of the new franchise owners. Staggering amounts of money for each team & shows why cricket has become the 2nd most popular & biggest sport on the planet. $932 & $692 million dollars (USA). Well done to @SGanguly99 & everyone at the @BCCI on the @IPL.â€ Wow ! Congratulations to both of the new franchise owners. Staggering amounts of money for each team & shows why cricket has become the 2nd most popular & biggest sport on the planet. $932 & $692 million dollars (USA). Well done to @SGanguly99 & everyone at the @BCCI on the @IPL https://t.co/pFkhKqv9ln â€” Shane Warne (@ShaneWarne) October 25, 2021 BCCI president Sourab Ganguly also expressed his delight on the valuation of new teams. â€œIt is heartening to see the inclusion of two new teams at such a high valuation, and it reiterates the cricketing and financial strength of our cricket ecosystem,â€ said Sourav Ganguly. Chennai Super Kings won IPL 2021, whereas KKR remained the runner-up. The post â€œCricket has become the 2nd most popular sport on the planetâ€: Shane Warne lauds the valuation of two new IPL 2022 teams appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer must prioritise fixing Manchester Unitedâ€™s â€˜leakyâ€™ defensive set-up, says Paul Scholes
creator: Metro Sport Reporter
description: Can the Norwegian turn it around at Old Trafford?
content: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is under intense pressure at Manchester United (Picture: Getty) Paul Scholes is hopeful Ole Gunnar Solskjaer can turn the dire situation around at Manchester United and believes his former team-mate must first look at fixing his â€˜leakyâ€™ defensive set-up in order to â€˜stop conceding chances and stop conceding goalsâ€™. The Red Devils suffered one of their most painful defeats of the Premier League era at the weekend as bitter rivals Liverpool thumped them 5-0 at Old Trafford, with Mohamed Salah completing a hat-trick and Naby Keita and Diogo Jota also scoring. Itâ€™s understood Unitedâ€™s board have considered sacking Solskjaer ahead of the sideâ€™s trip to Spurs and Antonio Conte, formerly head coach of Chelsea, Inter Milan and Juventus, is being heavily linked as a possible replacement. Scholes was scathing was his assessment of Sundayâ€™s wretched performance, singling out Mason Greenwood for criticism while also suggesting that Paul Pogba may have played his final match for the club after his red card at the Theatre of Dreams. However, speaking to the Webby & Oâ€™Neill YouTube channel 24 hours on from the loss, the legendary ex-United midfielder stressed that it was â€˜only three pointsâ€™ and backed Solskjaer to â€˜try and find a way forwardâ€™. Asked whether the Norwegian can turn it around, Scholes replied: â€˜Youâ€™d certainly hope so. It was a humiliating day for everyone involved with the club: the fans especially, the players worse I suppose and the manager worst of all. â€˜He will feel responsible for that. To be fair, I think when youâ€™re playing against a team like Liverpool, the way the team was set up wasnâ€™t quite right. â€˜I and a few people saw it on the Wednesday night against Atalanta. Everyone got carried away a little bit with the performance in the second half from what was a first half that was really disappointing against a poor team. â€˜And we played exactly the same way against Liverpool which I found surprising and we got what we deserved really. â€˜Can he turn it around? I hope so. We played with Ole for years and heâ€™s a resolute character. He came out fighting and at the end of the day itâ€™s only three points. You donâ€™t get anything more, you donâ€™t get anything less. â€˜Itâ€™s a little bit embarrassing but now heâ€™s got to try and galvanise the team and try and find a way forward. {"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Metro.co.uk","duration":"T4M52S","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/i.dailymail.co.uk\/1s\/2021\/10\/25\/14\/49612909-0-image-a-41_1635169258844.jpg","uploadDate":"2021-10-25T14:41:25+0100","description":"Manchester United fans speak on the future of manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer outside Old Trafford, following a five goal thrashing at home against Liverpool.","contentUrl":"https:\/\/videos.metro.co.uk\/video\/met\/2021\/10\/25\/5288742974419519069\/480x270_MP4_5288742974419519069.mp4","height":270,"width":480} To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video â€˜I think weâ€™ve got the players and the talent in the squad. Yesterday, yeah, you could say the gap was massive, but I think it was the way the team was set up. â€˜If he can set the team up in a way that isnâ€™t as leaky or gives as much space to these better team then I think weâ€™ll have half a chance because thereâ€™s no doubt the talent in the forward areas is good, world-class at times. â€˜Youâ€™ve got Cristiano [Ronaldo], brilliant goalscorer, young Mason [Greenwood], Marcus [Rashford], [Anthony] Martial coming back, so thereâ€™s some real talent in that squad. They just need to get the defensive side right and we know this team will score goals. â€˜But more importantly they have to stop conceding chances and stop conceding goals.â€™ Scholes hopes his former United team-mate can turn the situation around (Picture: Getty) Scholes added: â€˜Players sometimes get away with it and you have to say that the players really havenâ€™t performed over these last three or four weeks,â€™ he added. â€˜Okay, the manager will bear the brunt of it, of course he will, and itâ€™s up to him to turn it around. â€˜The fixtures arenâ€™t as friendly as you would have liked: Tottenham away, Atalanta away and Manchester City at home. â€˜Itâ€™s three points, a disastrous day, but theyâ€™ve got to fight back now. He has to find a way of stopping teams looking like theyâ€™re going to score goals against us.â€™ More: FootballMan Utd include Brendan Rodgers on four-man shortlist to replace Ole Gunnar SolskjaerCristiano Ronaldo becoming 'irritated' with Man Utd teammate after Liverpool defeatJose Mourinho has given Man Utd board 'fear' over Antonio Conte appointment Scholes appears to fancy Unitedâ€™s chances ahead of their trip to the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, with Spurs suffering back-to-back defeats away to Vitesse and West Ham. â€˜The players will be hurting and the manager will be devastated for these next two or three days, but youâ€™ve got to get over it,â€™ he went on. â€˜Thereâ€™s nothing you can do. Look forward to Tottenham and Tottenham arenâ€™t a great team. â€˜But itâ€™s going to be a difficult place to go with the form weâ€™re in.â€™ MORE : Antonio Conte makes decision over Manchester United job after initial talks with the club MORE : Manchester United defender Eric Bailly â€˜openly challengedâ€™ Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for picking Harry Maguire

title: Percat makes Walkinshaw Supercars return
full_description: Nick Percat will team up in Supercars with Chaz Mostert next year at Walkinshaw Andretti United. Supercars driver Nick Percat is going back to where it all began, signing with Walkinshaw Andretti United for the 2022 championship campaign. The 33-year-old has signed a multi-year deal with the former Holden factory team, joining fellow Bathurst 1000 winner Chaz Mostert in one of the most credentialed pairings on next year's grid. It's a homecoming of sorts for South Australian Percat, who came through the ranks at Walkinshaw Racing and won the Bathurst 1000 as Garth Tander's co-driver in 2011 for the then-Holden Racing Team. Percat debuted as a full-time driver with HRT in 2014 and would go on to finish third at Mt Panorama that year. After two seasons with Lucas Dumbrell Motorsport, Percat joined Brad Jones Racing for the 2017 championship and has been with the Albury-based team since then. In September he announced he was leaving BJR, just three months after signing a contract extension. "I'd just moved up here to the Gold Coast and I was pacing around my apartment. I rang Brad and had the conversation with him. I said I wasn't exactly happy anymore," Percat told Motorsport.com after his shock decision to quit BJR. "It was a surprise to both of us, but it was nothing personal against Brad or the team. "Something just changed in my head and I wanted to act on it, so I told him." The four-time Supercars race winner will form one of the strongest teams for the 2022 championship alongside Mostert - given Jamie Whincup's seat at Red Bull Ampol Racing is being taken by rookie Broc Feeney. Mostert, the 2014 Bathurst champion, has been with Walkinshaw for two years and is fourth in this year's championship standings heading into this weekend's Sydney SuperNight event at Sydney Motorsport Park. Australian Associated Press

title: 'Is that a typo': Some Newcastle fans can't believe 'masterclass' move from Â£12m ace for U-23s
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Newcastle midfielder Jonjo Shelvey started for the U-23s last night in a Premier League 2 fixture against Wolves. And the midfielder impressed. The Â£12m signing... The post 'Is that a typo': Some Newcastle fans can't believe 'masterclass' move from Â£12m ace for U-23s appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by Visionhaus/Getty Images Newcastle midfielder Jonjo Shelvey started for the U-23s last night in a Premier League 2 fixture against Wolves. And the midfielder impressed. The Â£12m signing from Swansea City has been out with injury for most of the season. Shelvey played briefly against Tottenham Hotspur before the midfielder was shown a straight red card after coming on as a substitute. And under caretaker manager Graeme Jones, Shelvey has been sent with the U-23s to regain his fitness for the duration of his suspension. And the 29-year-old put in a good shift. The Newcastle ace bagged two assists as the Magpies lost 3-2 to Wolves. Yet on social media, supporters were happy with Shelveyâ€™s performance on the night. title: 'As if Levy would pay': Some Spurs fans react as club reportedly eye Â£96m World Cup winner
creator: Dylan Walsh
description: Tottenham are reportedly keen on signing Ousmane Dembele, who is set to leave FC Barcelona just four years after joining the club for Â£96m. 90min... The post 'As if Levy would pay': Some Spurs fans react as club reportedly eye Â£96m World Cup winner appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by FRANCK FIFE/AFP via Getty Images Tottenham are reportedly keen on signing Ousmane Dembele, who is set to leave FC Barcelona just four years after joining the club for Â£96m. 90min claim that the Premier League is the most likely destination for the 24-year-old attacker. And that the likes of Manchester City, Newcastle United and Tottenham are all eager on Dembele. The wingerâ€™s contract with the La Liga giants is set to expire next summer. Yet despite a huge-money move to Spain a few years ago, Barcelona are eager to cut ties with Dembele. The 2018 FIFA World Cup winner has struggled massively with injuries during his spell in Catalonia. Indeed, a change of scenery could do Dembele and his career a world of good given his obvious talents. The north London side have struggled with both goals and creativity this season, and Dembele can offer both to Nuno Espirito Santoâ€™s side if he can stay fully fit. Yet for fans on social media, some are not certain on Dembele joining Tottenham in the coming months. Mainly due to the finances that could be involved. title: 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage
creator: Amir Mir
description: Liverpool fans have reacted on Twitter to footage of Alex Fergusonâ€™s reaction to Manchester United being 5-0 down at Old Trafford on Sunday. Moments after... The post 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage appeared first on HITC.
content: Photo by OLI SCARFF/AFP via Getty Images Liverpool fans have reacted on Twitter to footage of Alex Fergusonâ€™s reaction to Manchester United being 5-0 down at Old Trafford on Sunday. Moments after Mo Salah scored Liverpoolâ€™s fifth, the cameras panned to Sir Alex in the stands, with the Premier League legend expressing a sigh of frustration and a face of â€˜what have I just seen?â€™. What made matters even better for Liverpool fans is that pictures then showed Kenny Dalglish laughing away on another side of the ground. This is how his son, Paul Dalglish, reacted to the footage: 5-0 faces! pic.twitter.com/CWfZIVSlxHâ€” Paul Dalglish (@DalglishPaul) October 24, 2021 Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce Forâ€¦ ROONEY?!BridTV6077Newcastle Just Sacked Steve Bruce Forâ€¦ ROONEY?!886387886387center13872 It was perhaps an image summing up of what Manchester United fans would have felt, at that moment. And what the Liverpool faithful would have been thinking, because it was an utterly dominant display from them. Liverpool fans would have, no doubt, backed themselves to secure all three points before the weekendâ€™s game. But not many, if anyone, would have predicted Jurgen Kloppâ€™s side to put in such a dominant and now historical performance. This display and thrashing will be remembered for not just years, but decades to come. And what makes matters worse, for those in Manchester, is if Liverpool now go on to win the Premier League title this season. Nonetheless, here is a selection of Liverpool fans reacting to the Sir Alex footage: Imagine spending the best part of 3 decades & the majority of your career trying to knock the most successful team in england off their perch only to retire & watch everything you've achieved crumble around you while that said team takes it back & doing it in his backyard too.â€” Simesy (@Simon42915599) October 24, 2021 What makes it sweeter is that Fergie is still involved in team affairs â€“ he was the most influential in re-signing Ronaldo, not Solskjaer, not that it's doing #ManUtd any good.â€” Derek Brosnan (@DerekBrosnan) October 25, 2021 pic.twitter.com/qTpQdxYRHYâ€” Eii (@radityarvan) October 25, 2021 Seriously concerned Fergie's nose was going to actually explode at that point. pic.twitter.com/ZAQPAycoBBâ€” Lawrence Monk (@trendylefty) October 24, 2021 Only one Kingâ€” Stephen Finn (@ScarFinn79) October 24, 2021 Ferguson saying " this Liverpool team is light years ahead of us, they're a million miles in front of our treble winners too"â€” fracturedleg (@Fracturedlegs) October 25, 2021 No better smile than a king Kenny smileâ€¦.#uptheredsâ€” paul marshall (@PaulMarsh4053) October 24, 2021 This was one of the funniest things I have seen inâ€” post muzik (@postmuzik) October 24, 2021 The best bit of production Iâ€™ve ever seen on sky thisâ€” Baltic Fleet (@BalticFleetUK) October 24, 2021 The post 'One of the funniest': Some Liverpool fans & Dalglish's son react to Alex Ferguson footage appeared first on HITC.

title: Coach says more games the answer after Jets suffer reality check
creator: JAMES GARDINER
description: "There were a lot of positives. We created some really good chances. We also got punished for some pretty poor errors."
full_description: ON TARGET: Elvis Kamsoba opened the scoring for Sydney FC as the Sky Blues inflicted a 5-0 defeat of the Newcastle Jets at Macquarie University on Tuesday. Picture: Jaime Castaneda. NEWCASTLE Jets coach Arthur Papas believes his new-look outfit simply need games together after they were punished for their mistakes by a clinical Sydney FC. In their first hit out against A-League opposition - a modified trial played over three 45-minute periods - the Jets went down 5-0 in Sydney on Tuesday. "The result was disappointing," Papas said. "But the result doesn't always befit the performance. "I was pleased with a lot of aspects. There were a lot of positives. We created some really good chances. "We also got punished for some pretty poor errors. "At the other end, we hit the post a few times and weren't scoring goals. "It was a perfect test for us. The perfect opponent, the benchmark team in the league. "I said to the players at half time - that is a team that has been together four years. This is a team who is playing their first game together against a professional opponent. "We get to build on that and play more games." The Jets travel to Sydney to take on NSW NPL side APIA Leichhardt on Saturday and Macarthur (November 6) before their FFA Cup round-of-32 qualifier against Western United in Melbourne on November 13. FOCUSED: Jets coach Arthur Papas. Picture: Simone De Peak They kick off their A-League campaign against arch rivals the Central Coast at McDonald Jones Stadium on November 21. The Mariners beat Macarthur 3-1 in a friendly on Tuesday. "My main thing is to make sure on a daily basis we are improving," Papas said. "We know what points we need to focus on now." In an up-tempo and at times fiery contest, Elvis Kamsoba and Max Burgess swooped on mistakes to give Sydney a 2-0 lead at the first break. Marquee men Adam Le Fondre and Kosta Barbarouses struck in the second period to double the Sky Blues' advantage before Trent Buhagiar completed the scoring. For the Jets, Beka Mikeltadze, Savvas Siatravanis, Valentino Yuel and Jordan O'Doherty were denied by the woodwork. "I thought some of our movement was positive," Papas said. "Our ability to get in behind them and create chances was positive. Overall, we need to be a bit sharper. The precision of our first touch and our passing needs to be better. You get punished for it very quickly." After a 2020-21 campaign in which the Jets just avoided the wooden spoon, new coach Arthur Papas overhauled the roster and welcomed 15 fresh faces. READ MORE: JETS PRIMED FOR PRE-SEASON TEST READ MORE: SOUTH SUDAN EXPERIEMVE HAS YUEL HUNGRY FOR MORE READ MORE: TEENAGER NOT AFRAID TO 'STEP ON TOES' READ MORE: JETS GUNNING FOR FAST START They have been training since July, but due to COVID restrictions had been unable to test themselves against opposition teams. After an easing of the public health order last week, the Jets had two short hit outs against Northern NSW club Broadmeadow Magic, which they won comfortably. However, it was a big step up to heavyweights Sydney, who were coming off a 5-0 win over Macarthur. "Sydney had three new players - Elvis Kamsoba, Max Burgess and James Donachie. The rest have been together for for years," Papas said. "It was a great experience for a lot of our guys who were playing together against a professional team for the the first time. There wasn't anything that surprised us. "We know we have to keep getting better, keep working. "We got 90 minutes into a lot of them, we got 75 minutes into a lot of them ... that is the first time we had to do that against an A-League team." Papas said keeper jack Duncan did well considering the scoreline and also highlighted the efforts of Kosta Grozos, Siatravanis, Boumal and Mo Al-Taay. Meanwhile, Macarthur have moved swiftly to fill the void left by captain Adam Federici's unexpected retirement, signing Filip Kurto. Kurto joins the Bulls after previous stints at Western United and Wellington Phoenix. The signing of the 190cm Polish goalkeeper comes just days after ex-Socceroos shot-stopper Federici announced he was hanging up his gloves with immediate effect due to injury. That decision left Macarthur with only 21-year-old Nick Suman on their books as senior goalkeepers. Kurto, 30, was named goalkeeper of the year after an impressive campaign with the Phoenix in 2018-19 but was released by Western United in June after an injury-marred season which included repeated bouts of concussion. Bulls coach Ante Milicic said Kurto's experience will be a plus for his side heading into the new campaign. "Filip will bring his invaluable European and A-League knowledge and experience to our squad," Milicic said. "Alongside Nick Suman he will give us tremendous security in the goalkeeping department. "He has been outstanding in his A-League journey so far and I look forward to watching what he can bring under the guidance of myself and (goalkeeping coach) Glen Moss for the upcoming season." Macarthur open their second ALM season against the Phoenix at Campbelltown Stadium on November 21. IN THE NEWS: Our journalists work hard to provide local, up-to-date news to the community. title: Filosofische Hamilton waarschuwt Verstappen: "Het is nog niet voorbij!"
creator: Jesse Janse
description: Lewis Hamilton is en blijft strijdlustig, tot aan de laatste snik. De Brit, die afgelopen weekend werd verslagen door Max Verstappen en zijn achterstand in het kampioenschap zag groeien, geeft zich logischerwijs nog lang niet gewonnen!
content: Tijdens een op papier sterke periode voor Mercedes wist Lewis Hamilton geen gat te slaan in de strijd om de wereldtitel. Sterker nog, door een straf in Turkije verloor hij de leiding in het kampioenschap aan Max Verstappen. De Nederlander wist afgelopen weekend in de Verenigde Staten zijn voorsprong verder uit te breiden. Nu er twee ciruits aankomen die op papier Red Bull beter liggen, kan Verstappen met een comfortabele voorsprong de laatste drie races van het jaar ingaan. Hamilton weet echter dat niets vanzelfsprekend is tijdens het Formule 1-seizoen 2021 en is en blijft zeer strijdlustig. De strijd is nog langer niet voorbij. Daags na de race laat Hamilton zich uit op Instagram, waar hij uitpakt met de tekst: "It's not over! Maandag was een dag van reflectie. We hebben op zondag alles gegeven, maar achteraf heb je altijd door dat je meer had kunnen of misschien wel moeten doen. We beoordelen, hergroeperen, laden ons weer op en gaan het gevecht weer aan!" "Er is nog steeds tijd. Er zijn obstakels, maar samen kunnen we alles bereiken als we ons daar op richten. Laten we blijven pushen, iedereen! We blijven fit, we blijven sterk, we blijven gefocust en still we rise !", aldus de Mercedes-coureur filosofisch. De volgende Grand Prix is over een kleine twee weken, in Mexico. Daar zal Hamilton proberen zijn achterstand van twaalf punten op Verstappen te verkleinen of te laten verdwijnen.

title: RV against clock to fix scanner for Cup runners
description: Melbourne Cup internationals, including Twilight Payment and Spanish Mission, had X-rays of their limbs taken on Tuesday, as Racing Victoria aims to have its standing CT scanner fixed late Wednesday.
full_description: Melbourne Cup internationals, including Twilight Payment and Spanish Mission, had X-rays of their limbs taken on Tuesday, as Racing Victoria aims to have its standing CT scanner fixed late Wednesday. The busted digital board â€” albeit untimely a week out from the Cup â€” is understood to be a world-first malfunction of the part responsible for generating the scanner images. A cargo flight carrying the American component is due to touch down on Wednesday, with technicians on standby to repair the $1.27m standing CT scanner at U-Vet Equine Centre, Werribee. The standing scanner was introduced in 2019 to help RV and the University of Melbourne understand and further help reduce limb injuries in horses. News Corp Australia understands the scanner was fully maintained and serviced ahead of the spring carnival period but the malfunction, â€œa truly unique occurrenceâ€ could not be foreseen. An RV spokesman confirmed the scanner malfunction would form part of the annual review into the entire spring carnival, including the stringent veterinary processes. The unfortunate situation generally has triggered talks within industry groups about the need for a failsafe â€” should current screening rules stay in place â€” in the event of another malfunction, given what is at stake and the impact on connections. As announced on Monday, the 15 Melbourne Cup fourth acceptors who had not undergone a standing CT prior to the machine breaking down will be subjected to high quality X-rays. The X-rays must be reviewed and cleared by three international imaging specialists for Cup horses to press on towards Flemington next Tuesday. RV mandated a stringent veterinary screening regimen after Anthony Van Dyck last year became the sixth Cup runner in seven years to sustain a catastrophic injury. The fact the four internationals this year passed a series of scans â€“ including the contentious scintigraphy â€“ prior to arriving in Australia gives RV some clarity and peace of mind. The standing CT scanner was used voluntarily by connections previously to check or help diagnose potential issues, but this year all Cup horses must be scanned before Thursdayâ€™s deadline. Should any of the high quality X-rays taken the past 48 hours highlight an area of concern the horses may be required to undergo a standing CT scan on Thursday, subject to availability. This would also apply to any Cup-nominated horses who contest Wednesdayâ€™s Bendigo Cup and have not yet had a scan. Horses face additional scrutiny beyond the scans, including a new Cup eve veterinary inspection. What is the standing CT scanner? A large, fixed structure located at the University of Melbourneâ€™s U-Vet Equine Centre in Werribee. When introduced in 2019 it was the first of its kind in Australia. A second was introduced at the Randwick Equine Centre in Sydney this year. Why was the CT scanner brought in? What improvements does it provide on? The standing CT scanner was introduced to understand and further help reduce limb injuries in horses. Apart from early identification of issues, before they become serious or fatal, a major benefit of the standing CT scanner is it can be used on horses with limited sedation. Traditional CT machines require a horse to undergo a general anaesthetic, meaning itâ€™s not suitable for the precautionary screening of all Cup horses. Traditional/previous testing methods Up until 2020 horses only underwent scanning before the Cup if they were injured or vets needed further information to diagnose a possible injury. In 2021 that has changed to precautionary scanning of all Cup horses, regardless of their condition. All Cup horses are traditionally subjected to a pre-race veterinary examination â€“ a visual/manipulative assessment where they are trotted up before a panel of vets â€“ on the Thursday or Friday before the race. This year, an additional one has been scheduled for Cup eve. Which horses have/havenâ€™t been scanned? 19 of the 35 fourth acceptors for the Melbourne Cup have been presented for a standing CT scan since October 16, in line with the RV veterinary requirements for the race. The four internationals â€“ Spanish Mission, Twilight Payment, Away He Goes and Sir Lucan â€“ have not been scanned in Australia but did clear all diagnostics since their last race start and prior to departure. Has the machine already ruled out other horses this year? Yes, Cup nominees Young Werther and Harpo Marx have been withdrawn after their scans highlighted areas of concerns. All CT scans and X-rays are reviewed by a panel of three veterinary specialists (one each in USA, UK and Australia) and the results presented to the RV veterinary team to make a decision on each horseâ€™s suitability to race. Are horses at a heightened risk of injury without this scan? No, the risk of injury is the same as with any physical/athletic activity. How much does the machine cost? RV together with the University of Melbourne and the State Government invested $1.27 million What is being done if a horse canâ€™t undergo a standing CT scan? All acceptors yet to undergo a standing CT scan are required to undergo a comprehensive high-quality X-rays of their distal limbs on October 26-27. Should the X-rays taken at U-Vet identify any area of concern, the horse may be required to undertake an MRI or standing CT scan (subject to availability) on or before October 28. If the replacement part arrives in time, can a horse get scanned by Thursday night? All Cup horses will undergo a standing CT scan or high-quality X-rays by Thursday night. Thursday is the cut-off for horses who will be mildly sedated for their standing CT scan or X-rays (if required) in order to produce a clear drug test for the sedative on Cup Day. Originally published as Racing Victoria against the clock to fix CT scanner for Melbourne Cup runners To join the conversation, please log in. Don't have an account? Register Join the conversation, you are commenting as Logout Fred Kersley is using the frustration of finishing second in last yearâ€™s Victoria Derby as motivation to go one better this time. Epsom Handicap winner Private Eye has drawn near the outside for Saturdayâ€™s Golden Eagle but trainer Joe Pride just wants a solid tempo in the $7.5 million feature. When cancer survivor Felicity Krzanic received a slot in the Four Pillars, she settled on a horse renowned for his fighting spirit, just like her close friend Nini Vascotto.

title: â€œThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 teamâ€: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years
creator: Advait Jajodia
description: Grabbing a close 111-108 win against the Raptors, the Chicago Bulls now start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time since the 1996-1997 season. Over the past couple of years, the Chicago Bulls have been a lottery team at best, failing to make the postseason consistently. However, this offseason, the Bullsâ€¦ The post â€œThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 teamâ€: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years appeared first on The SportsRush.
content: Grabbing a close 111-108 win against the Raptors, the Chicago Bulls now start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time since the 1996-1997 season. Over the past couple of years, the Chicago Bulls have been a lottery team at best, failing to make the postseason consistently. However, this offseason, the Bulls front office managed to surround Zach LaVine with some talented players like DeMar DeRozan, Lonzo Ball, among many others. And all of a sudden, this squad looks to be a pretty deadly bunch of players. As expected, the Bulls have been playing much better than they have over the past few years. After defeating the Pistons, Pelicans and again the Pistons in their first three games, LaVine and co. looked confident entering the Scotiabank Arena. Even though the Raptors managed to cut down the lead tremendously, it was Chicago winning their 4th consecutive game. It was an efficient night for DeMar, finishing with 26 points, 6 assists and 4 rebounds on 36.8/50/100 shooting splits, with Zach contributing 22 points on 43.8% shooting from the field, helping Chicago win 111-108. And with this win, the Bulls now have started the regular season with a winning 4-0 record. The Chicago Bulls mean business pic.twitter.com/2vlyUAkzF0 â€” SportsCenter (@SportsCenter) October 26, 2021 Also Read: NBA Twitter reacts to the Celtics starâ€™s insane overtime poster over Hornetsâ€™ Miles Bridges NBA Twitter reacts to Chicago Bulls and their first 4-0 regular-season start since 1996-97 campaign The Bulls are one of only three teams who are undefeated, and the only team to win all four of their games. The last time they did so? Back when Michael Jordan was leading the team during the 1996-1997 season. NBA Twitter went crazy with reactions after the Bullsâ€™ 4-0 record. The Chicago Bulls good at basketball again pic.twitter.com/GUgCJj1zGv â€” Dev (@goatkurosaki) October 26, 2021 I canâ€™t see the Chicago Bulls losing any time soon. This is literally the 96-97 bulls in 2021 â€” Troydan (@Troydan) October 26, 2021 The Orlando Magic started 4-0 last season and ended up eliminated in the Playoffs.. lol â€” James3 (@Son0faBeach305) October 26, 2021 BEST TEAM IN THE LEAGUE CONFIRMED pic.twitter.com/WIXHJNK5AE â€” Delusional Lonzo Fan(4-0) (@DelusionalZoFan) October 26, 2021 Also Read: Nets head coach Steve Nash warns the return of a prime James Harden After winning the game on the road, the Bulls will go back to Chicago and play the Knicks and the Jazz. While this team might not be the title favourite, it surely can cause a problem for many powerhouses. The post â€œThis Chicago Bulls team is as good as the Michael Jordan 1996 teamâ€: NBA Twitter reacts as Lonzo Ball, Zach LaVine and co. start the regular season with a 4-0 record for the first time in 25 years appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Paper Talk: Salah agent sets new demand as Euro giant prepares move; Man City in double battle for exciting signings
creator: Samuel Bannister
description: There has been a fresh update regarding the state of play between Mohamed Salah and Liverpool in their contract negotiations The post Paper Talk: Salah agent sets new demand as Euro giant prepares move; Man City in double battle for exciting signings appeared first on TEAMtalk.
content: There has been a fresh update regarding the state of play between Mohamed Salah and Liverpool in contract negotiations, while Manchester City are battling the same rival for two players â€“ all in Tuesdayâ€™s transfer gossip. AGENT RAISES SALAH WAGE DEMANDS Mohamed Salah is seeking a weekly wage of Â£500,000 from any new contract he signs at Liverpool. Salah recently indicated a desire to spend the rest of his career at Liverpool. However, as things stand, his contract will expire in 2023. Liverpool have thus outlined his situation as a priority issue to resolve. But given his status as arguably the most in-form player in the world, an extension will not come cheap. Approaching his 30s, Liverpool must weigh up whether it would be worth investing in Salah for a longer term. But on current form it would seem unreasonable to consider letting him go. That may play into his hands â€“ or his agentâ€™s â€“ and details have now emerged of what he would be demanding from a new contract. According to Football Insider, Salah wants half a million pounds every week as part of a new Liverpool contract. It would make him the clubâ€™s best-paid player of all time. Such a figure is slightly higher than what had previously been reported and will give Reds chiefs some serious thinking to do. Representative Ramy Abbas is driving the demands for his client. As long as Salah continues his fine form, their position will be strengthened. Now, it will be up to Liverpoolâ€™s Boston-based owners to make the final decisions. At present, they are â€œreluctantâ€ to give him a new deal on money-no-object terms given that they would last until his mid-30s. Therefore, an agreement is â€œsome way awayâ€ despite Salahâ€™s recent promising comments. That may be a concern given that Ekrem Konur is reporting that Real Madrid are monitoring the situation and will move for Salah if Liverpool fail to tie him down. Conte, Zidane, Ten Hag: Who will replace Solskjaer if he gets the sack at Man Utd? MAN CITY IN DOUBLE TRANSFER BATTLE Manchester City could battle Bayern Munich for the signature of Barcelona midfielder Frenkie De Jong. (Calciomercato) City and Bayern are also in a race, along with Monaco, for Ajax winger Antony. (Daily Mail) Derby County have been the subject of a Â£50m takeover bid from American businessman Chris Kirchner. (The Sun) AND MORE TRANSFER GOSSIP The agent of Ousmane Dembele has contacted Newcastle and Barcelona over a potential transfer. (Sport) Man City have joined the race for Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Denis Zakaria. title: Smithâ€™s empathy for the fickle finger of Stokes
creator: Daniel Brettig
description: Steve Smith knows what star England all-rounder Ben Stokes meant when he gripped the bat after finger surgery and immediately thought â€œIâ€™m backâ€.
full_description: Steve Smith knows what Ben Stokes meant when he gripped the bat handle after his second round of finger surgery this year and immediately thought â€œIâ€™m backâ€ - a moment that has reshaped the whole picture of this summerâ€™s Ashes series. Back in February 2019, towards the latter stages of his Newlands ban, Smith removed an elbow brace after surgery and, a matter of days after he had questioned his future in the game, posted a video of himself batting in the nets. Smithâ€™s 2019 Ashes heroics flowed from there. Steve Smith is rationing his net sessions following more elbow trouble earlier this year. Credit: Getty Images While Smith has admitted he is still rationing his own famously prolific net sessions after another bout of elbow trouble earlier this year, his empathy for Stokes - and also New Zealand captain Kane Williamson, also currently battling an elbow problem during the T20 World Cup - is clear. â€œItâ€™s never comfortable when youâ€™re going through some pain out in the middle,â€ Smith said from Dubai. â€œI think Kane Williamson is probably one going through it at the moment, I think heâ€™s got some tennis elbow stuff that I had earlier this year going on, and itâ€™s not a very comfortable place to be in. â€œWhen you canâ€™t fulfil your duties the way youâ€™d like to, the way you normally would, itâ€™s never ideal. [Iâ€™m] glad that Stokesy has been able to get his finger sorted and I saw some footage of him the other day back batting, so good signs. â€œAny team is more dangerous when youâ€™ve got someone like Ben Stokes playing. It certainly adds a lot to their depth, but weâ€™re excited and Iâ€™m glad, personally, that heâ€™s able to be back playing some cricket. It makes for a really good series.â€ Itâ€™s been a year of batting famine for Smith, who, after the home Test series against India, stepped away for more elbow rehab and a slow return to something near his best. Even now, Smith said, he was still on something of a batting diet - never more than two sessions on consecutive days. â€œI know a few months ago I was only allowed to bat for 10 minutes, and then it went to 15, 20 and I worked my way up to 45 minutes in the nets,â€ Smith said. â€œAt that point it was back, basically, to normal and I could carry on with my business. â€œBut Iâ€™m still taking it easy at the moment, just making sure Iâ€™m only batting two days in a row, not three days in a row, and Iâ€™ll build up again as we get closer to playing some longer format stuff.â€ For now, Smith is playing a less conspicuous â€œanchorâ€ role in the Australian middle-order, either coming in to salvage the innings after early wickets or, as is yet to happen, being demoted below other power hitters, such as Marcus Stoinis, should Aaron Finchâ€™s team make a strong start. â€œThatâ€™s essentially my role, I think Iâ€™ve done it pretty well in the first couple of trial games and our first game against South Africa,â€ he said. â€œSo I know what I need to do, the rest of the team knows my role, I think weâ€™re all very clear on the way we all want to play, so that clarityâ€™s there, itâ€™s just about going and doing it. â€œSometimes you need an ability to be able to get off strike and manipulate the ball to certain areas, more than just the power. [On] some of these wickets even the powerful blokes have struggled to hit sixes, so you need some smarts about you in the middle and playing the situation and having the ability to limit dot balls and get off strike. â€œFor me thatâ€™s pretty simple but it depends who Iâ€™m batting with as well. Itâ€™s about batting in partnerships - if Iâ€™m batting with Glenn Maxwell, my job is to get him on strike and let him go about his business, and the same with some of the other stronger guys.â€ Looking ahead to the Ashes, where Smithâ€™s wicket will be far less expendable, he expressed optimism that some extensive centre wicket sessions against Australiaâ€™s vaunted pace attack and focused mental preparation would steel him in ways previously derived from Sheffield Shield games. full_description: Darching â€“ Vier Punkte aus den ersten vier Spielen, das war die Vorgabe von JÃ¼rgen Primbs, dem Trainer der Volleyballerinnen der DJK Darching. Seine Mannschaft hat das umgesetzt. Die andere Partie verloren die Darchingerinnen zwar mit 0: 3 (23:25, 22:25, 18:25) gegen den TSV Gars. Auch hier Ã¼berzeugte die Darchinger Mannschaft aber mit viel Einsatz und Ã¼berraschte in den ersten beiden SÃ¤tzen mit knappen Ergebnissen. Im Spiel gegen Gars startete die junge Regina Utz auf der Zuspieler-Position. â€Sie hat ihre Sache sehr gut gemachtâ€œ, lobt JÃ¼rgen Primbs. Seine Mannschaft zeigte anders als am ersten Wochenende kaum AusschlÃ¤ge nach oben oder unten. â€Das Team hat relativ homogen gespieltâ€œ, sagt Primbs. â€Aktuell kann man im Angriff keine Spielerin herausheben. Das ist SchwÃ¤che und StÃ¤rke zugleich. Mal sehen, wie sich das entwickelt.â€œ AuffÃ¤llig sei aber, dass die DJK Darching mit schnellen BÃ¤llen Ã¼ber die Mitte wenig Gefahr versprÃ¼ht. â€Da sind wir noch zu leicht auszurechnenâ€œ, sagt Primbs. Gegen den VC DJK MÃ¼nchen-Ost/Herrsching III lief mit Fini MÃ¼ller die zweite junge Zuspielerin auf. â€Auch sie hat gezeigt, warum wir in Zukunft auf sie bauen.â€œ Im ersten Satz machte die DJK Darching noch zu viele Eigenfehler und punktete im Angriff zu selten. Doch die Mannschaft steigerte sich. Im zweiten Satz gab es zwei lange Aufschlagserien von Maria Kaiser und Marie AndrÃ¤, die erfahrene Keppsi Huber verlieh der Mannschaft StabilitÃ¤t. Nur im dritten Satz machte es die DJK noch einmal spannend: Nach 24:19-Vorsprung hieÃŸ es auf einmal 24:24. â€Da wollte die Mannschaft anscheinend noch ein wenig Nervenkitzelâ€œ, kommentiert Primbs. Doch Darching gewann mit 26:24, brachte auch den vierten Satz mit 25:20 nach Hause und fuhr den ersten Saisonsieg ein. Nach vier Spielen liegt die DJK nun auf dem fÃ¼nften Platz der Bezirksliga Ost. Allerdings hat dieser Rang wenig Aussagekraft, weil einige Mannschaften noch kein einziges Spiel absolviert haben.
